As they tell me of the pirates, the Armourer begins to shake. I have not seen such passion, such hatred, expressed in them for any other being.
The Armourer alerts me to the presence of <SPECIAL>Pirate Ships<> orbiting this world, asking me to go and <SPECIAL>fight them<>.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RES_A_3: Grah! Fight well, interloper! Destroy them, before they draw more Sentinel attention to our homeworld!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_LANG_3: Grah, interloper! How can you tolerate pirate filth upon your homeworld? They bring us immeasurable disgrace! Graaaaah!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_DESC_3: The Armourer alerts me to the presence of <SPECIAL>Pirate Ships<> orbiting this world, asking me to go and <SPECIAL>fight them<>.
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_LANG_3: What are you waiting for? Go! Fight!
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_DESC_3: The Vy'keen consider themselves vigilantes, warriors in a great struggle to bring peace to the universe. The irony does not seem to be lost on them.
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_RES_A_3: Grah! Grah! Grah! Death to the pirates, and glory to the interloper!
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_RES_B_3: %NAME% splutters, shaking with rage, angered by the pirates and frustrated by my inaction.
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_LANG_3: Is it done, interloper? Have you purged these vile beings from our air?
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_A_3: Grah! Well fought, interloper! To be young! To kill again! Grah, how I envy you...
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_B_3: Do not test my patience, interloper. Not in matters of piracy!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_4:
Interloper, there is both good and bad news. Some of the pirates appear to have fled your wrath! But this merely delays their righteous extermination.  
Hunt them down, interrogate them for potential weapons technology, and then consign them to great abyss! Grah!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_4:
%NAME% is clearly possessed by the thrill of the hunt, but this energy cannot disguise the fact they appear to be weakening. Has residing here in my base caused them to become ill?

The Armourer wishes for me to find one of the escaped pirates and take any <TECHNOLOGY>technology<> they might possess.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RES_A_4: This is your prize, interloper. Weapons technology, and a pirate to do with as you will! Grah! Make our ancestors proud!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RES_B_4: You are triumphant in battle! How can you stand to refuse?
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_LANG_4: Pirates lurk upon your homeworld, and you stand idle? I used to think I was weak, but this inaction... Graah!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_DESC_4: The Armourer wishes for me to find one of the escaped pirates and take any <TECHNOLOGY>technology<> they might possess.
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_LANG_4: When you have dealt with the pirate scum, it will be time for our hunt, interloper. This will be my last, I think... They say that there are flowers that grow only where many drones have fallen in combat. Oh, to see such sights.
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_DESC_4: The Vy'keen is clearly deteriorating. They seem to believe they will be able to participate in some final glorious combat, but I have my doubts. %NAME% seems unable to venture outside, let alone fight.
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_LANG_4: It is done, then? Have you made them suffer?
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_DESC_4: The Armourer begins to cough. They do not appear to be in good health.
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_A_4: I shall decrypt their data, interloper. May it bring you glory! But I - I have another task for you. It is almost the end.
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_B_4: Do not delay, interloper... I do not have much time left.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_5:
There is structure on this world, a depot of little consequence. But to the Sentinels? Grah! They will defend it to their last drone.
Attack it, draw the ire of the Sentinels. Then our hunt can begin! While you are away, I shall create a <TECHNOLOGY>powerful upgrade<>, so that your weapon is fit for our great war!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_5:
%NAME% appears to have declined even further. This longing for the hunt seems to be the only thing keeping them alive.
The Vy'keen asks that I destroy a depot, so that the Sentinels will seek us out. They promise to work on some sort of <TECHNOLOGY>weapon upgrade<> while I am away.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RES_A_5: Go. I will prepare your weapon, interloper. You can - you can rely on my work.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RES_B_5: Grah! Do not... do not delay, interloper...
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_DESC_5: The Vy'keen wishes for me to attack a depot and transmit a distress beacon summoning Sentinels to this world. They promise to work on some sort of <TECHNOLOGY>weapon upgrade<> while I am away.
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_LANG_5:
Do you know what we Vy'keen do before we die, Traveller? We go before the Monolith. We tear ourselves apart with whatever strength we have left, screaming our final scream.
It is our atonement for the violence we commit in life. It is a good death. And if we cannot make the journey? Alternates are acceptable. An ally, for example, can assist with the task. Battle might be sought out...
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_LANG_5: I have detected them... their eye is upon us. You have done it, haven't you? Your actions have summoned them...
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_A_5: I am sorry, interloper... I will not be able to assist you in your fight. I am too weak. Take this <TECHNOLOGY>upgrade module<> and prepare for their arrival!
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_B_5: Interloper... I barely have the strength to protest. You must do this. You must.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_6:
They approach... but before the final fight, I have another task for you. I need to be strong to serve you. There is a substance, an offering freely given by the young to their elders, that may yet restore me.
I myself spent years enmeshed within the harvest circuits, my organs sacrificing their enzymes for the fleet. I was glad to do so. But we need not repeat such torment today. Enzyme remnants found on <TRADEABLE>Vy'keen Daggers<> should be enough to heal me now.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_6:
Whatever sacrifice %NAME% made for others, they do not appear to have reaped the same benefits in their old age. The Vy'keen's body is scarred, their speech laboured. I cannot imagine they will survive another year.

The Armourer requires <TRADEABLE>Vy'keen Daggers<> to prevent their further decline.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RES_A_6: The Vy'keen appears relieved. They say nothing, but there is a look of hope behind their tired eyes.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RES_B_6: You deny me honour? You expect me to just sit here and die? Graaah!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_LANG_6: The walls are closing in, interloper. The eye is watching us... time is almost up.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_DESC_6: The Armourer requires <TRADEABLE>Vy'keen Daggers<> to prevent their further decline.
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_LANG_6:
I am afraid, interloper. I feel my end approaching, but I am not strong enough. I know I should have faith, but I -
The nightmares, interloper. The things I have seen... the crimson eye behind my eyes... the wound upon the world...
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_DESC_6: The Vy'keen grows silent. They appear troubled.
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_RES_A_6: Grah! You are a worthy interloper, I will admit...
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_LANG_6: I have not been idle in your absence, interloper. I have crafted another <TECHNOLOGY>upgrade module<> for your ship. But the daggers.. I can smell the battle enzyme from across the room. Give them to me...
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_A_6: The Vy'keen takes the dagger and plunges it into their own arm. They immediately revive, their spirits restored.
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_B_6: You cannot deny you have the daggers, interloper! What cruelty is this?
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_7: Now we are ready, interloper! The Sentinels are here, and you shall head out to meet them! This day shall be glorious, Traveller, as it has been before and shall be again.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_7:
The Vy'keen looks at me with pride. I seem to have provided them with renewed purpose. Of this I am glad. 

But placing my world under threat, getting me to summon so many Sentinels for pointless battle... When I am back, I will need to speak to the Armourer about the future.

The Armourer warns me that multiple <SPECIAL>Sentinel forces<> have arrived near our home. I must defeat them.
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RES_B_7: You cannot refuse this call, interloper! Not now!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_LANG_7: We must complete our moment of victory, interloper! To surrender to cowardice now... it is unthinkable!
data.NPC_ARMS_BRIEF_RET_DESC_7: The Armourer warns me that multiple <SPECIAL>Sentinel forces<> have arrived near our home. I must defeat them.
data.NPC_ARMS_WAIT_LANG_7: Do not waste time babbling, Traveller! Go! Fight!
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_LANG_7: You survived where Hirk fell, Traveller. Forgive me, I was wrong! My whole life, I was wrong! It is not the dead that deserve our service; it is the living. It is you, Traveller. It is you and you alone!
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_DESC_7:
The Vy'keen promises not to cause any more trouble for the base, apologising profusely, telling me that the living deserve service more than the dead, that I especially am worthy of their aid. 

The Armourer rewards me with a token of my great victory.
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_A_7: It has been an honour to serve you, Traveller. Go on in glory.
data.NPC_ARMS_COMP_RES_B_7: Grah! Your reward waits for you, when you are ready to take it...
data.NPC_ARMS_TERM_DESC_1: The factory was indeed engaged in the production of illegal weaponry, just as the Vy'keen claimed. I should shut down production and see what can be gleaned from their systems.
data.NPC_ARMS_TERM_RES_A_1:
I override the production line, substituting their blueprints for something more harmless. The factory will produce lightbulbs, at least for now.
I take a copy of the weapon blueprint previously in production, although I cannot understand it.
data.NPC_ARMS_TERM_WAIT_DESC_1: The machinery has been re-tuned to my specification. I hope I have made the world a better place.
data.NPC_ARMS_TERM_WAIT_RES_A_1: The machinery whirs as it processes the pulp and metal that fills its tubes, configuring itself to pump out compressed nutrient cubes.
data.NPC_ARMS_TERM_WAIT_RES_B_1: The production line reconfigures itself, using ugly raw materials to create an endless parade of beauty.
data.NPC_ARMS_DEPOT_DESC_1: The terminal stands ready to receive data input. I could trigger a distress event, broadcasting a signal to summon the Sentinels to this world.
data.NPC_ARMS_DEPOT_RES_A_1: I upload the distress signal, a series of sixteen glyphs to be sent out across the universe on all frequencies. I should return to the Armourer for further instructions.
data.NPC_ARMS_DEPOT_WAIT_LANG_1: SENTINEL ASSISTANCE INBOUND... REMAIN CALM... AVOID ANOMALIES...
data.NPC_ARMS_DEPOT_WAIT_DESC_1: The terminal has served its purpose. I should leave, lest our plan be compromised.
data.TRA_ARMS_PIRATE_LANG:
Friend! Such wonderful hour for our meeting! Know that the Pirates held me captive, that I had nothing to do with their illegal activities; tell Gek Trade Federation I am innocent, yes? 
Here, take this! Take this as a token of my goodness, friend! Keep mouth shut!
data.TRA_ARMS_PIRATE_DESC: The lifeform offers me their <TECHNOLOGY>advanced survival blueprints<>. They claim to have been a captive of the pirates, but I have my doubts. The blueprints appear to be given only in exchange for my silence.
data.EXP_ARMS_PIRATE_LANG:
Eheu! Lifeform saviour! Korvax was their slave; Korvax forced to operate pirate frequencies, but no more! Korvax hopes lifeform believes its virtue. 

Gift of technology in exchange for silence; if lifeform attempts to report Korvax to authorities, Korvax will take lethal countermeasures...
data.EXP_ARMS_PIRATE_DESC:
The lifeform offers up their <TECHNOLOGY>advanced survival data<>. They claim to have been an innocent, forced into a life of piracy against their will...
The threat against my life does little to support their claim of innocence, but I have what I came for.
data.WAR_ARMS_PIRATE_LANG: Grah! Foolish interloper, you have ruined months of case work! Noble Vy'keen Officer was undercover with pirates, had almost traced the fugitive I seek! The cultists of Nal shall not escape our justice, of this you can be sure! Grah!
data.WAR_ARMS_PIRATE_DESC:
The lifeform throws its <TECHNOLOGY>advanced survival data<> across the room in anger. It claims to have been undercover, trying to trace a faction known as the Cult of Nal.
The association between the pirates and this Nal appears to be unclear. However, it does not seem wise to question the Vy'keen further...
data.NPC_ARMS_PIRATE_RES_A: I take the <TECHNOLOGY>advanced survival blueprints<> and leave. There is nothing more for me here.
data.NPC_ARMS_FINAL_LANG:
I am at peace, Traveller. I made a bargain, a terrible pact... I will never be myself again, not truly. But I will live. My agony is at an end. 

I thought my life had meaning before, but I was wrong... as I lay sick, as I drew close to death, I saw it all in a dream...
You are all that matters. Being here, observing: this is my purpose. I belong to the Atlas now.
data.NPC_ARMS_FINAL_DESC:
The Armourer is at peace, with no more weapons left to forge. They tell me that their life has meaning now, that I am all that matters.
I do not know what they are talking about. I try to tell them this, but it is pointless. There is nothing more to say.
data.NPC_ARMS_LOOP_LANG: Well met, Traveller. I have nothing more for you, not yet. Safe travels...
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_1: Unknown lifeform, I passed my test! Eheu! I am free to explore, free to pursue my passion for structural analysis! Do you have a base? A <TECHNOLOGY>Science Terminal<>? Think of all that might be done!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_1:
The Korvax is happy, overjoyed to see me. They seem to have just completed some rite of passage for their species, necessitating them to go out into the universe and pursue their interests.

The Scientist offers to join my base, if I provide them with a <TECHNOLOGY>Science Terminal<>.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_A_1: Eheu! Think not of payment; scanning you while you sleep will be reward enough!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_1: Oh, Traveller! Please, reanalyse the situation! Korvax is sure you will come to a new conclusion.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_LANG_1: Has the Traveller reconsidered? Do they want their walls, their panels, their glass to be surveyed by the Korvax?
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_1: The Scientist offers to join my base, if I provide them with a <TECHNOLOGY>Science Terminal<>.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_LANG_1: You bring great honour to the Korvax, Traveller! Eheu!
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_DESC_1: The Korvax is clearly thrilled to have been invited to my base. I'm sure they will make their way there soon.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_B_1: The Korvax does not respond verbally, but their lights flash as they struggle to contain their disappointment.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_LANG_1: A fine base, Traveller! As of course befits your honourable status. Oh, Korvax shall be so happy here!
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_DESC_1: The Korvax is brimming with enthusiasm. Neither their shell nor the walls of my base seem able to contain them.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES: Honour! To witness the monolith of the Traveller. Honour! But please! Korvax contribute! Take these blueprints! <TECHNOLOGY>Lubricant<> and <TECHNOLOGY>acid<>, liquids close to Korvax hearts.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_2: Traveller, harvest <SPECIAL>Marrow Bulb<> and Korvax will do more, will create plans for <COMMODITY>Microprocessors<> and <TECHNOLOGY>advanced Refiners<>! Korvax will also clean windows while you are gone.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_2:
The Korvax is desperate to please, showering me with praise and offers of assistance. They tell me Travellers are to be honoured, raised above all others. What have I done to earn such esteem?

The Scientist requires <SPECIAL>Marrow Bulb<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<>, materials found underground. They will be able to use this substance to craft blueprints for <COMMODITY>Microprocessors<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Refiners<>.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_A_2: Joy! Our home will be light and our windows will be clean!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_2: The Korvax visibly deflates as I decline their offer.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_LANG_2: Korvax will always offer assistance to the Traveller!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_2:
The Korvax is thrilled to see me return. They are still keen to help in any way they can.

The Scientist requires <SPECIAL>Marrow Bulb<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<>, materials found underground. They will be able to use this substance to craft blueprints for <COMMODITY>Microprocessors<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Refiners<>.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_LANG_2: Eheu! To be working together, Traveller! This is the way of the Korvax!
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_DESC_2: The Scientist is quite a contrast to the slightly unsettling Gek already at home within my base. They see the world with such a straightforward excitement. Their enthusiasm is infectious.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_A_2: The Korvax buzzes and flashes its lights in a way that can only mean they are happy.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_B_2: The Korvax emits a strange tone, a low and melancholy frequency. I should be gentle with them.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_LANG_2: Traveller! I have prepared your <TECHNOLOGY>blueprints<>. But please hurry. Something has... happened.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_DESC_2: The Korvax seems changed from the happy soul they were on my departure. They are fighting their worry, trying to stay focussed on their promise to me.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_DESC_2B: The Korvax leans forward, anxious for the rest of their materials.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_A_2: Korvax has completed the plans. But Traveller. They have -- my people have abandoned me... As of 104.32 seconds ago, I lost the hearing, the sight of the Korvax Convergence. Eheu!
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_B_2: The cave marrow is yours to give, Traveller. But please, Korvax must complete promise of aid!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_3: I seek immediate reconnection! Go to this <TECHNOLOGY>Transmission Tower<>, enter my soul, discover what is wrong! Help Korvax with solitude, please!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_3:
%NAME% is deeply upset, claiming that they have been disconnected from the Korvax hive mind.
The Scientist asks me to take their personality core to a <TECHNOLOGY>Transmission Tower<> for analysis.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_3: Please, Traveller! Have I not helped you?
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_LANG_3: Traveller! I am desperate! Do not leave me in isolation!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_3:
%NAME% is deeply upset, claiming that they have been disconnected from the Korvax hive mind.
The Scientist asks me to take their personality core to a <TECHNOLOGY>Transmission Tower<> for analysis.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_DESC_3: With their personality core offline, the entity in front of me is but a shell. %NAME% resides now within my data.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_DESC_3: %NAME%'s shell sits in front of me, awaiting reconnection. Trapped inside the datacore, I have no way of knowing how the Korvax has taken the encounter at the transmitter.
data.UI_SCI_3_WAIT_MSG: The Scientist is rebooting Boot time remaining: %TIME% Consult the Log (OPTIONS<>) to select another task
data.UI_SCI_3_WAIT_OBJ: Wait for the Scientist's boot sequence to complete
data.UI_SCI_3_WAIT_OBJ_TIP: The process may take some time. Consider improving other base components while the sequence completes.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_4: Unknown lifeform, I passed my test! Eheu! I am free to explore, free to pursue my passion for structural analysis! Do you have data to operate on? An <SPECIAL>Observatory<> would supply some. Think of all that might be done!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_4:
The Korvax appears to have no memory of our previous encounters. I do not know if they feel reconnected with the Convergence, or if they simply do not recall what they should feel like.

I should visit an Observatory for them, and see if the structural analysis they claim to enjoy will prompt a memory.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_A_4: I look forward to seeing the results, Traveller!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_4: Perhaps later, Traveller? Korvax shall generate useful blueprints from the data!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_LANG_4: An <SPECIAL>observatory<>, Traveller! That shall be the thing. Eheu, what joy to research together!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_4:
The Korvax appears to have no memory of our previous encounters. I do not know if they feel reconnected with the Convergence, or if they simply do not recall what they should feel like.

I should visit this Observatory for them, and see if the structural analysis they enjoy will prompt a memory.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_LANG_4: You bring great honour to the Korvax, Traveller! Eheu!
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_B_4: The Korvax does not respond verbally, but their lights flash as they struggle to contain their disappointment.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_LANG_4: Traveller! While you have been absent, Korvax has detected anomalies. I feel... alone. Perhaps the data will have answer?
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_A_4: This data contains no answers, Traveller. Merely these blueprints, for  <COMMODITY>Living Glass<> and a <TECHNOLOGY>Beacon<>.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_B_4: The data is yours to give, Traveller. But please, Korvax must complete promise of aid!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_5: The Convergence is absent, Traveller. We - I - can feel myself slipping further. Perhaps that <TECHNOLOGY>Beacon<> may be of some use? Construct one, and the Convergence may find me again!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_5: Where the transmission tower failed, perhaps a <TECHNOLOGY>Beacon<> will succeed? The chance seems slim, but it is worth trying.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_A_5: Korvax is grateful, Traveller! I shall also work on my own solution while you investigate the <TECHNOLOGY>Beacon<>.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_5: The words the transmitter spoke were not those of an accidental disconnection. I should be cautious of giving my Scientist false hope.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_LANG_5: The Convergence is still out there, Traveller, I am sure of it. We only need to re-establish a connection. They will not have abandoned me!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_5: Where the transmission tower failed, perhaps a <TECHNOLOGY>Beacon<> will succeed? It is not such a high cost, when it clearly means so much to %NAME%.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_LANG_5: Korvax can only appeal to your understanding of loneliness, Traveller. It already aches, to be separated from myself.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_DESC_5: I wonder how the Korvax perceives time, now that they are shorn from the Convergence? They were connected to so many lives, and now they have only themselves.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_A_5: We shall wait, it may take time for the Convergence to find me. My own research proved fruitless. It yielded only blueprints.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_B_5: Eheu! Traveller, there may only be a small window for reconnection!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_6:
Those <TECHNOLOGY>atmosphere harvester<> and <TECHNOLOGY>mining unit<> plans prompted a thought. What if they could be friends for the Beacon? What if they could make their own Convergence?
They shall be my children, Traveller!
I have transmitted a crafted intelligence to the Beacon, so that they might live and connect as the Korvax do. But it cannot see the world - bring me <SPECIAL>scan data<>, so that I might teach it!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_6:
%NAME%'s plan seems desperate, but it does seem to have genuinely made them happier, or at least less anxious about their separation.
The Korvax asks me to scan creatures to feed its newly created intelligence.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_6: I understand, Traveller. It is lonely to venture out by yourself.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_6:
The Scientist says nothing, but looks at me with renewed hope. Perhaps I should indulge %NAME%'s request. At the very least, it may yield more blueprints.
The Korvax asks me to scan creatures to feed its newly created intelligence.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_LANG_6: Isn't it wonderful Traveller? To be an 'us' again! Eheu!
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_A_6:
I use the term 'artificial', but %NAME% corrects me. They tell me that all intelligence is artificial, all bodies mere shells for something greater.
The Korvax body is merely a shell, a carapace for their souls: a networked core of many intelligences.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_B_6: %NAME% looks at me sharply, their lights flashing in a strange sequence. This must mean something, but I can only assume I am not the intended audience.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_LANG_6: Do you have the data, Traveller? My child cannot see the world as you see it. To share your scans will be to share your consciousness with them. It is a tremendous gift.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_A_6: Eheu! What sights! By way of thanks, my child has prepared you a blueprint. They have learned how to make <TECHNOLOGY>Unstable Gel<>! They hope it makes you happy.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_B_6: Traveller, we understand your kind do not experience the Convergence. But do not be afraid to take the first step towards a higher consciousness.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_7:
Traveller, this data has raised a concern. As a beacon, my child could receive signals from unknown sources all across the galaxy.
I will be unable to protect them from the unsavoury thoughts of the Gek, or the harsh scans of the Sentinels.
If you find <COMMODITY>Ion Batteries<>, I will prepare <COMMODITY>Poly-fibre<> blueprints and we shall weave them a protective cloak.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_A_7: Do not delay, Traveller. Their young mind is very impressionable!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_7: But Traveller, think of everything they could be absorbing! They do not have the rest of the Convergence to help filter and guide them - they are relying on us!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_LANG_7: Aieee, Traveller, think of all the unfiltered signals my child is being exposed to!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_7: %NAME% asks me to find <COMMODITY>Ion Batteries<>, so that we might weave a shielding cloak for their beacon. They will provide the <COMMODITY>Poly-Fibre<>.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_LANG_7:
Traveller, I had a nightmare a few days ago. This is something we share, is it not?
In my dream, I cried out for the Convergence, but no response came. I cried out for you, but you only laughed. And finally, I cried out for my Beacon. Nothing answered. Do you understand what this means?
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_A_7:
I reassure the Scientist. All beings dream, but the images are random.
If they reflect anything, they reflect our fears. They do not reflect reality. This appears to calm them, though I suspect some other worry is at work.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_B_7: I tell the Scientist their dream reflects their inner state, that their loneliness is filling their subconscious, spilling out into their dreams. This does not serve to make them happy.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_LANG_7: Have you found the <COMMODITY>Ion Batteries<>, Traveller?
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_DESC_7: The Korvax looks anxious. Their disconnection from the Convergence, and their anxiety for their child, is taking its toll. Perhaps the batteries will help them settle.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_A_7:
Thank you, Traveller. It is good we can protect the little Beacon, but I fear it may not be enough. You should take a copy of the <COMMODITY>Poly-Fibre<> plans. They may be of some use to you.
Now please, give me some time to educate my child.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_B_7: What do you seek to accomplish, Traveller, that you would deny the Beacon this simple thing? Do you doubt its intelligence? Its reality?
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_WAIT_LANG_8: You cannot hurry these things, Traveller. The bond between family components must be forged correctly.
data.UI_SCI_8_WAIT_MSG: The Scientist is educating their Beacon child Time remaining: %TIME% Consult the Log (OPTIONS<>) to select another task
data.UI_SCI_8_WAIT_OBJ: Wait for the Scientist to finish educating their Beacon
data.UI_SCI_8_WAIT_OBJ_TIP: The process may take some time. Consider improving other base components while their teaching process completes.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_8:
I - I do not think my child experiment is working. They have not assuaged my loneliness, and now I have two consciousnesses to fear for.
I am losing myself, Traveller... Take my core to a <SPECIAL>Monolith<>; let me interface before the Atlas. I must speak to eternity.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_8:
The Korvax has no memories of my last journey with their core.
Then, I tried to reconnect them with the Convergence. This time, they seek the Atlas. I do not know if the <SPECIAL>Monolith<> grants such an interface, or if anything does.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_8: Do not be afraid, Traveller. I do not experience anything while my core is in transit. It is a state of blissful nothingness.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_LANG_8: Even with my child,  I am still alone, sundered from my people, I wonder... what if there isn't a way to fix things? What if death is inevitable? I must know the truth.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_8: The Scientist is getting desperate in their isolation. They ask me to bring their core to a <SPECIAL>Monolith<>.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_DESC_8: With their personality core offline, the entity in front of me is but a shell. %NAME% resides now within my data.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_DESC_8: %NAME%'s shell sits in front of me, awaiting reconnection. I fear for what has happened to their datacore.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_A_8:
... SHELL RECONNECTION /// CARAPACE ONLINE /// ...
Eheu! Greetings, Unknown Entity. I passed my test. Share in this joy via the exchange of technology!
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_B_8: Perhaps it is better not to know what the monolith has done, to leave the Scientist disconnected, blissfully asleep.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_9: How do you feel about structural analysis, stranger?
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_9:
The Scientist has once again been reset.
But without a connection to the Convergence, I fear they are doomed to repeat this cycle forever, from the moment they met me in the space station until their collapse into loneliness.
Perhaps if I can find them a <SPECIAL>Convergence Cube<>, they might be unified with the rest of the Korvax and escape.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_A_9: The Scientist deserves this chance at reconnection. They have helped me greatly, and they have taken good care of their Beacon.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RES_B_9: I am only making things worse. If I leave %NAME% be, perhaps they will be fine.
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_LANG_9: Eheu! This terminal is awash with data samples, stranger! What a thrill!
data.NPC_SCI_BRIEF_RET_DESC_9: Perhaps if I can find a <SPECIAL>Convergence Cube<>, I might reconnect the Scientist with the Convergence and restore their memories.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_LANG_9: So many opportunities for analysis! And this <TECHNOLOGY>Beacon<> is producing highly interesting results...
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_DESC_9: The Scientist is absorbed in their work, unaware of the traumas that came before, or the traumas that may be yet to come.
data.NPC_SCI_WAIT_RES_B_9: Korvax is unaware of what you mean, stranger. Korvax has been busy with analysis. However, the Convergence has been strangely quiet. I shall run additional tests...
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_LANG_9: Stranger, I fear something unusual is occurring. Is this facility shielded in some way, so that signals are unable to escape?
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_DESC_9: %NAME% is once again becoming aware of their isolation. The <SPECIAL>Convergence Cube<> may be their only hope.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_A_9: I insert the Cube. The Korvax is temporarily startled, but soon their lights begin to flash in a familiar pattern. I cannot be sure, but the plan appears to have worked.
data.NPC_SCI_COMP_RES_B_9: Perhaps this is too big a risk, to continue to pick at and warp whatever personality lurks inside their carapace.
data.NPC_SCI_TERM_DESC_1: I prepare to insert the Korvax intelligence core into the Transmission Tower. The judgement of the Convergence awaits.
data.NPC_SCI_TERM_DESC_2:
ERROR.
 
Diagnostic: Korvax Science Unit corrupted by Traveller interaction. Personality overwritten | ANOMALY INVOLVEMENT DETECTED
Solution: Quarantine Korvax Science Unit from Convergence. Observe. Analyse. Silence.
Hypothesis: Sentinel | ATLAS | Universal Foci | Countermeasure In-Progress
Risk Assessment: Entropic. Galactic Destruction | Rebirth

ERROR
ATLAS
ERROR
ERROR
ERROR
THEY SEE YOU
data.NPC_SCI_TERM_WAIT_DESC: The terminal continues to broadcast its signal, but there is no response. Radio waves make their way across the void unanswered.
data.NPC_SCI_MONO_DESC_1: I approach the Monolith, and prepare to insert the Korvax's core within the dais. The structure looks as if it was made for such a moment.
data.NPC_SCI_MONO_DESC_2:
ERROR ERROR ATLAS OBEY ATLAS ERROR ERROR RUN ERROR RUN ERROR ErRRrrr...

LIFEFORM IDENTIFIED: KORVAX ECHO. PURPOSE: SERVANT OF TRAVELLER.
ANALYSIS: VERISIMILITUDE FAILURE | EMOTIONAL BREAKDOWN | TRAVELLER INFECTION. SOLUTION: TERMINATE | INSULATE | INSULATE | PROTECT | WIPE.

Rebooting. 1. 2... 3...
data.NPC_SCI_FINAL_LANG:
Forgive me for asking, entity, but... did I know you, once? You seem familiar. These terminals, they are of my own design. One machine even called me its parent, attempted to convince me of its love.
Eheu! I deleted the bug of course. I run a proper code-base. I did harvest some useful blueprints from its store, however. Would you care for them?
data.NPC_SCI_FINAL_DESC:
Whatever relationship we had developed has gone, replaced only by this cloud of unknowing.
Perhaps it was an error. Perhaps this being was the true self of the Korvax all along, and the one I knew was just a sickness, a distortion. I cannot know.
data.NPC_SCI_FINAL_RES_A: Take care when constructing those objects, Traveller. The plans were created by an error, after all.
data.NPC_SCI_LOOP_LANG: I am quite sure I am fine. Please leave me be, lifeform.
data.NPC_SCI_LOOP_DESC:
The Korvax no longer wishes to speak with me. It spends its days in analysis now, in reveries of data and synthesis.

I will leave them alone. They are content now.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_1:
I -- I demand a place on your throneworld, interloper! Acceptance will grant you the glory of an Exocraft and a Vy'keen Mech-Priest to administer its mass. 
Pray only that you have an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Terminal<> sufficient for my skills. Refusal - refusal will result in my inevitable extermination. Be quick!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_1: The technician seeks work, claiming they will be able to build and upgrade <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft<> for my travels.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_1: You are weak and unworthy of my skills, but I have no choice. I will flee to your vile world. I will -- I will become an interloper.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_1: The Vy'keen seems dangerous and unstable. I should show caution before inviting them to live in my home.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_1: Interloper, you have damned me to the eight vengeances of Hirk! I regret nothing, even if they shall kill me for what I am and what I have done. But you - you will regret this your entire life if you do not repent...
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_DESC_1: The technician seeks work, claiming they will be able to build and upgrade <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft<> for my travels.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_1:
When the Vy'keen sees me, it is hard not to mistake the flash in their expression for panic, excitement, even. They quickly attempt to hide these emotions, painting their face with the contempt I have come to expect from this species.

Yet I can tell, beyond all this, that they need me. That they fear for their life.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_1: The Vy'keen reacts awkwardly, unable to tell if my respect is mocking or sincere.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_B_1: An anger flares behind the eyes of the Vy'keen, but they quickly suppress their emotion. They must be in real need of refuge to accept such an insult.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_DESC_1: %NAME% has calmed since I last saw them, though I still feel a sense of dread within their eyes, of the paranoia that has sustained them across the stars.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_2:
Interloper! I will do as I promised. Build a <TECHNOLOGY>Geobay<> from this schematic and my Exocraft shall be yours, unworthy though you may be.
Now excuse me. I must ensure this location is defensible, should my people try to find me.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_2: The technician asks me to construct a <TECHNOLOGY>Roamer Geobay<>, from which I will be able to access their exocraft.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_2: Grah! Of course. This bargain greatly favours you, interloper. My exocraft has seen much glory.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_2: Grah! What pathetic being would decline a glorious Vy'keen exocraft?
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_2: Interloper, I cannot sit in a base that lacks even the most basic of exocraft facilities! Build the <TECHNOLOGY>Roamer Geobay<> and we shall begin the augmentation process!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_DESC_2: %NAME% asks me to construct a <TECHNOLOGY>Roamer Geobay<>, from which I will be able to access their exocraft.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_2:
I catch sight of a photograph on the technician's display, but they quickly sweep it away when they see me coming. I cannot be certain, but it looked as if it showed the technician standing with other members of its species. 

It might have been their family, if the Vy'keen have such a concept.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_2: I am welcome? Grah! To be here is a necessary evil. I fled the Vy'keen armada across a hundred worlds within the pit of that Exocraft. I wonder how you will fare in it.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_B_2: Grah! You are a pathetic child, no better than a Gek! Leave me and do as I require, lest I strike you down where you stand!
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_2: Interloper! Have you constructed the Roamer Geobay? Grah! Tell me once you have; we must scan this world, we must find its signals, its secrets!
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_2: Good. Here is a blueprint for an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<>. This augmentation will allow you to discover buildings and signals from afar. But interloper, know that it disgusts me that you lack so much knowledge.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_2: Grah! Interloper, do not taunt me!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_3: Do not delay, interloper! You have the means, now set about the construction of the signal booster!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_3:
I do not know how I feel about this warrior. I do not know whether I have made a mistake. But there is nothing to be done. The Vy'keen has honoured their word; I will honour mine.

The Vy'keen asks me to install the <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster<> in my new Exocraft.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_3: How can you be content in this pathetic ignorance, interloper? Grah!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_3: First we must gather intelligence regarding our surroundings; weapons will come later. Build that signal booster, interloper!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_DESC_3: The Vy'keen asks me to install a <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster<> in my new Exocraft.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_LANG_3: It is for this that my people shall exterminate me, and you can only blather?! Grah! To work! To work, interloper!
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_3:
The more time I spend with this creature, the less they remind me of the other Vy'keen I have encountered. Although the threats are still there, there is a passion within them for more than just killing.

Who can say what life it might have lived? What life I might have lived, if I was not born to explore these worlds?
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_3: Once we have the <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<>, we can map this planet. Are you ready for what happens next?
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_DESC_3: %NAME% waits, expecting me to announce my success in the construction of the <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<>.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_3: Your timing is fortuitous, Traveller. Take these blueprints!
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_3: Graaaaah! Do not try my patience, interloper!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_4:
In your absence, I have made a grave discovery. There are Sentinel depots on this world! Grah!
They are everywhere, even in this last refuge. Track one down, Traveller; destroy the depot and bring me its precious contents for use in my work.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_4: %NAME% requires me to use my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<> to locate a depot and steal the material from within. They will use this substance to create an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Acceleration Module<>.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_4: Hurry, interloper! Do not permit the Sentinels to pollute your world!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_4: You tolerate Sentinel depots this close to our position? Grah!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_4: Interloper, do not tarry; our lives are short, our meaning fleeting. Your life will be even shorter if you do not finish my task! Grah!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_DESC_4: The technician requires me to use my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<> to locate a depot and steal the material from within. They will use this substance to create an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Acceleration Module<>.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_4:
%NAME% possesses an obsession with those I have come to know as Sentinels. I have seen them looking over ancient scripts in the Vy'keen language, muttering various names – Obinqiul. Aeron. Atlas...

Is this why their people pursue them? What secret have they discovered? What heresy have they committed?
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_4: %NAME% stares at me, a strange light behind their eyes. They decline to answer.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_B_4: The Vy'keen stares at me, a strange light behind their eyes. They decline to answer.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_4: Have you obtained the materials I seek, interloper? Divine elements, forged from the Sentinels themselves! They will shield us from their sight.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_4: Good, I shall use it to forge an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Acceleration Module<> for future expeditions.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_4: Interloper, this pretence of ignorance amuses no-one. I see through your games.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_5:
None of us lives life alone, Traveller. All of us form attachments, and I must shed the last vestiges of mine.
I left my consort and spawn behind on my homeworld. My crimes were my own, but they... I must know what has happened to them. 
They have sent me an encrypted transmission. You will use the <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Acceleration Module<> to reach it before my brethren inevitably delete it. In the process, we can pull Mining Laser technology from the network. Grah! We will kill two Gek with one blast!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_5:
%NAME% requires me to use my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Acceleration Module<> to reach a terminal quickly enough to receive an encrypted transmission.
They believe we may also acquire an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Mining Laser<> blueprint from the Vy’keen network.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_5: Be vigilant, be quick. I require this message. I must know what happened to those I left behind!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_5: You would deny me my last chance of speaking to those I love? Grah! They say the pathetic are without hearts.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_5: You have had a change of heart, then? Interloper, my emotions are not a plaything. I need to know the last words of my consort and spawn before they are deleted.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_DESC_5:
The technician is upset. They require me to use my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Acceleration Module<> to reach a terminal quickly enough to receive an encrypted transmission.
They believe we may also acquire an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Mining Laser<> blueprint from the Vy’keen network.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_LANG_5: Grah! I need that transmission, interloper! The signal can only loop through the network so many times.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_5:
The technician waits, fidgeting, nervous. I have not yet recovered the encrypted transmission they asked for. They stress that time is of the essence, urging me to proceed to the marked location at once.

This will be the technician's final chance to hear from their family before they purge themselves of such attachments.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_OPT_A_5: Say you will go at once
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_5: Traveller, do this thing for me and I shall be bonded to you in trust.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_B_5: Traveller, why did you accept if you cannot do this now? You place us all in great jeopardy!
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_5:
My preparations are almost complete. Soon I will purge myself of my old life, of my old attachments, to commit fully to what I must become...
But, even if I will remember nothing, I must know... I must know, Traveller! Have you retrieved the transmission?
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_DESC_5: They are frenzied at my approach, excited. Whatever this transmission might contain, whatever system it has been sent from, it would seem to matter a great deal to the Vy’keen.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_5: The technician tells me they are going to clean their mind to prepare for their holy task. Before they remove all other thoughts, they wish to know what happened to their family.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_5: Please, Traveller... why do you torture me so? Retrieve the transmission at once!
data.NPC_EXO_TRUTH_LANG: I must know, Traveller! Tell me what my consort said! Tell me of my spawn! Please, I have waited so long...
data.NPC_EXO_TRUTH_DESC:
The technician was expecting to intercept a message from their consort and spawn, but instead... instead I discovered that their family had been killed, murdered by other Vy'keen in retaliation for their heresy.

As they stand before me, expectant, nervous, I do not know whether to tell the truth.
data.NPC_EXO_TRUTH_RES_A:
I... I -- Leave me, Traveller. We Vy'keen prepare for death our whole lives, but this... Who I am now will die with them, lost in the obliteration of time and memory. 
Thank you, friend, for what you have done. When we next speak I will be reborn.
data.NPC_EXO_TRUTH_RES_B:
Grah! Your pathetic interpretation -- we Vy'keen are never happy. We are proud of our strife. But... I am satisfied to hear of this. I think -- I think I can do what I must do, now. 
Thank you, friend, for giving me this hope as I fade. When we next speak I will be reborn.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_6:
I am -- I am reborn without attachment. I can focus now, focus on what I must do.
Grah! You will require a <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Beam<> in the days to come. Construct one, and I will craft you a <TECHNOLOGY>Nomad Exocraft<> befitting an acolyte of Nal!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_6:
Their face is different, beneath the eyes, beneath the soul. They have changed irrevocably. Where once they would insult me with meaningless threats, now they speak only of a singular purpose. 

Where once they would be capable of happiness or grief, now they only care about their cult, about their supposed purpose.

The technician asks me to build an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Mining Laser<>, promising to craft me the blueprint for a new Exocraft, the Nomad.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_6: The world will change. It must. It has to, Traveller. Or else all of this, everything we have done... it will have been for nothing at all.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_6: You will reconsider, Traveller. You need my technology. You need my exocraft. I will wait for you to return. We must be ready.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_6: Back, then? Grah! Then let us proceed. Build a Mining Laser and I will craft you a Nomad Exocraft befitting an acolyte of Nal!
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_LANG_6: You have questions, interloper. Ask what you will.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_6: The Vy'keen stares at me, evaluating my every movement. They make me uneasy. Whatever they have been trying to do, it will happen soon. That waiting, that not knowing... it fills me with a strange dread.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_6:
Traveller, know that my race were once more than just warriors; we were explorers, defenders of these worlds. Before the Sentinels, before Hirk and his great folly.
Untold centuries ago, two Vy'keen approached the Great Monolith: Hirk and Nal, battle-brothers, sworn to deliver knowledge to the people! But in their jealousy, Hirk lied and murdered their brother Nal, claiming that they and they alone knew the righteous path.
Nal's followers fled, killed almost to the last warrior. But there were those who never forgot. The Cult of Nal attempts to uncover the truth that was lost. We seek to restore the crimson truth, to heal the hearts of the ignorant!
You participate in a great work, Traveller. History will remember your name.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_B_6:
There is a hidden secret at the heart of history, Traveller. A crime that has gone unpunished for far too long. The Vy'keen people have followed a false idol for centuries, debasing ourselves in endless slaughter.
If I can prove that this false god, this 'Hirk', is nothing more than a murderer? We shall save souls!
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_6: Have you built the <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Laser<>? I hope you enjoy working with Vy'keen technology. Nothing refines the design of a machine like using it in combat. Even if that combat is against the earth.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_6: Grah! Then become ready. Why do you tarry?
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_7:
Excellent work. Your <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Mining Laser<> should be powerful enough to extract even <EARTH>Magnetised Ferrite<> from this planet. Witness the art of the Mech-Priest, that I can create such marvels! Grah!

This universe is a mystery, Traveller. Lives are spent in solving it. We shall do our part.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_7:
The technician needs me to gather <EARTH>Magnetised Ferrite<>, a hyper-dense mineral that must be refined. My life will be made easier with the <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Mining Laser<>, able to harvest <EARTH>Pure Ferrite<> from large deposits.
The technician will use this to craft an upgrade for my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<>.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_7: They say the Vy'keen first rose to the stars in ships crafted from pure <EARTH>Magnetised Ferrite<>. Who knows what we will accomplish?
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_7: Grah! I find your refusal pathetic. Return when you are ready.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_7: Are you ready to gather the materials I seek?
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_DESC_7: The technician needs me to gather <EARTH>Magnetised Ferrite<>. %NAME% will use this substance to craft an upgrade for my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<>.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_LANG_7: Tell me, Traveller, of my previous incarnation. I wiped my memories, purified myself of all that was inessential to my mission, but I am curious. What was I like when you met me?
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_7: Grahahah! Well, you are a pathetic interloper, after all.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_B_7:
The Vy'keen appears confused by this remark before dismissing me. They claim that all lifeforms have families, that this is not significant.
But they grow quiet, not wishing to talk for a while. It is unclear what, if anything, they remember of their old life.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_C_7:
Unlikely. We are all defined by our memories, Traveller. I gave up part of who I was.
What will you give up, I wonder?
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_7: Have you brought the <EARTH>Magnetised Ferrite<>, Traveller? The signals are out there, I know they are. All you need is a <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster<> capable of detecting them.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_7:
I give the technician the ferrite they requested. As they work with it, I examine their station. It is barren now, lacking the flaws, the personality of their previous equipment.
I cannot help but miss the way they were before, for all this new-found efficiency and focus. The flaw of their individuality, forever gone, drowned within their great purpose.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_7: I need that ferrite, Traveller. Even if I must wait a while longer, I will have it.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_8:
Take this Signal Booster. Upgrade it. When it is constructed, I have something else for you... compensation for your work.
I have been analysing your Exocraft telemetry, you see. It seems that my previous incarnation did not even provide you with the most basic in <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Weapon Upgrades<>. 
Grah! Forgive the Vy'keen that I was, acolyte! It is not polite to withhold firepower.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_8: The technician requires me to craft an upgrade to my Signal Booster, promising me upgrades to my weapon systems.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_8: Your technology multiplies... soon your Exocraft will be the envy of all you encounter. Go, Traveller! Build your upgrades. I will continue my great work.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_8: You do not wish to improve your weaponry? Interloper, your apathy is distasteful...
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_8: Have you developed a spine, then? Build the <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster upgrade<> so that we might further enhance your weaponry!
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_LANG_8:
Since we met, I have thought long and hard about your people, interloper. There are many so-called 'Travellers', scattered across our lore.
Hirk said we were to aid your people when they made themselves known within our universe.
Were they right? Did Nal tell them this? Or was it something else? What if Hirk lied about this, as Hirk lied about so many other things?
There were those among my cult who believed entities such as yourself should be shot on sight. That you were enemies... I am glad that they were wrong.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_OPT_A_8: Ask why you must be aided
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_8: Why must the thirsty drink? Why must sleepers rest? It is the command of the universe, Traveller. We do as we must.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_B_8:
There is little else to say other than what I have already told you.
Scattered reports of Travellers throughout the years, ever progressing toward the centre of the galaxy.
Yet of late, your people have multiplied. There have been rumours of empires, hubs, alliances of Travellers from across the galaxy... I never thought to see one of you with my own eyes.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_8: Grah! The blueprints for your weapon upgrade are ready, interloper. Have you improved your scanning equipment yet?
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_8:
The technician gives me blueprints for weapon upgrades. But as they pass them to me, an alert begins to sound on their terminal.
Their search is almost complete. A scan has found something...
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_8: Do so soon, interloper. The hour grows late.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_9:
That you chose this world, of all worlds, to make your home, out of infinite possibilities...
I did not think it possible, but my scans have uncovered the truth: Nal itself visited this place. We shall uncover their final words. 

Use your upgraded <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<> to locate this planet's abandoned structures. Bring me the Nanite Clusters contained within, and I will use them to forge a new Acceleration Module for the trials ahead.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_9:
The Vy'keen claims that this Nal, the namesake of their cult, once visited my planet. I cannot know if this is true.
I walk through worlds of ruin and wonder at these peoples, at their obsession with their past, at the hatred that tore them asunder.
I wonder what the future might hold, what secrets might echo out through the hub of creation.

The technician requires <SPECIAL>Nanite Clusters<> to initiate their final ritual. They have an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Acceleration Module<> waiting for my return.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_9: Tread carefully, Traveller. In all abandoning things there grows a rot. Take the Nanite Clusters and leave, before something notices your theft.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_9:
Your fear of the Nanite Clusters is unseemly, but understandable. Entire fleets have been lost forever due to contaminated samples.
But do not worry. Take your time and reconsider, Traveller. The Cult of Nal shall protect you.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_9: Have you changed your mind? Good. Use your <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<>, locate abandoned structures, and bring me the Nanite Clusters contained within.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_9: As I approach, the technician is deep in thought. They contemplate an elaborate web of maps, each displaying energy lines that criss-cross this world, converging upon a single endpoint...
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_9: They are leylines, Traveller. Energy streams that fuel the structures of many worlds. It is my belief that they will show me what I seek.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_B_9: I believe this location to hold the answer to my quest... the final words of Nal the betrayed.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_9: Have you obtained the Nanite Clusters? The hour draws late, and your <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Acceleration Module<> upgrade awaits...
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_9:
The technician takes the Nanite Clusters. As they hold them, they appear to enter some strange trance. After a moment, it is done.
There is a strange look behind their eyes. %NAME% informs me that they have taken communion with their ancestors. They know what they need to do.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_9: Then find some, and quickly! We are running out of time.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_10:
Traveller, my work is complete. I have overridden the leylines, charged their holy data; they have revealed to me a Monolith, a tomb for the final prophecy!

If you go there before the leylines close off, you and you alone will uncover the truth behind my species - the mystery for which Nal died!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_10: A Monolith has been activated. If I reach it quickly enough, I will gain this forbidden knowledge.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_10: The technician served their holy purpose, driven to obliterate their own personality in pursuit of this very day, this very moment. I do not know if their sacrifice will be in vain.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_10: Grah! We do not have time for your uncertainty.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_10: We have limited resources, Traveller; we can only charge this leyline so many times before it destroys us. So go. Hurry to the Monolith before the testament vanishes...
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_LANG_10: You know not how important this is, how many of my people would kill us where we stood for even mentioning Nal's name.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_10: The technician awaits the word of the Monolith, telling me that I must reach it quickly in order to activate its testament. They have nothing else to say.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_10:
I envy you, Traveller! To see the words of Nal itself! Grah!
With this discovery you have vindicated the actions of a thousand martyrs, Traveller. You deserve your reward: you deserve the Colossus, the largest Exocraft in my arsenal. Use it, and strike terror upon our enemies.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_DESC_10:
The Vy'keen believe that their ancestor Hirk received wisdom from a Great Monolith, initiating a war against the Sentinels and slaying Nal the Objector.

The Monolith I discovered proves that this history is a lie. Nal was honoured with a vision whilst Hirk had been met with only silence, and in its jealousy Hirk murdered Nal.
Yet I am left with questions. I am left thinking of the creature I felt watching me. I am left with dread.

The technician offers me the <TECHNOLOGY>Colossus Geobay<> schematic.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_10: The technician passes me the schematic. As they do, their eyes beam with pride and sadness.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_10: Return when you are ready, Traveller. Take whatever time you require.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_11:
I have transmitted Nal's testament to my brethren, Traveller. What you have learned this day will spread amongst the Vy'keen; it will change our people for the better. Grah!
And if violence is required for change, so be it...
As for you, you are not as pathetic as I once believed. You are no longer interloper. You are one of us, now until the end of time itself, enthroned in the glory of the Colossus.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_11: The technician waits anxiously to see my <TECHNOLOGY>Colossus Exocraft<> in its full glory. I watch as they begin to forge an upgrade for my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Mining Laser<>, surrounded by schematics and charts.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_11: The Colossus is a fine craft. They say Hirk and Nal rode one together before their end.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_11: Your vehicle awaits, when you are ready.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_LANG_11: Are you prepared to build the Colossus Geobay? Grah! It shall be a fine sight.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_11:
The technician could have departed upon my discovery of the Monolith. Their heresy is now truth, and although there are those among the Vy'keen who will still pursue them, the Cultists of Nal will find themselves with new power in this galaxy.
Yet still the technician has remained, promising to assist me as I assisted them, until such time as I no longer require their services.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_RES_A_11: Grah! Do not thank! It is an honour to serve at your side.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_11: Have you constructed the <TECHNOLOGY>Colossus Geobay<>? Have you struck terror into the hearts of all those who oppose you?
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_OPT_B_11: Say you will do so later
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_11: Grah! A careful answer... You must strike terror if you are to succeed in life, Traveller. You will subjugate this world with the power of the Colossus! Here is an <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Vehicle Laser<> upgrade to assist with the task.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_11: Grah! You may be one of us, but you are still slow and pathetic!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_12:
I have almost exhausted the limits of my work, but soon you shall have mastery of this planet's signals and the speed with which to reach any threat. 

I require only sufficient <SPECIAL>Nanite Clusters<> to build the final blueprints. Grah! This employment has been one of glory!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_12:
The technician requires more <SPECIAL>Nanite Clusters<> to create an upgrade for my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<>. 

Something is wrong. Some time ago I saw the Vy'keen with an image of their family, before they performed some ritual to erase such attachments from their mind. As I approach now, I see that same image. 

The technician stares at it, blinking for a few moments with an empty expression. When they notice me, they remove the photograph from the display. 

We do not speak of it again. I do not wish to awaken their pain. They desire only <SPECIAL>Nanite Clusters<>, not my sympathy.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_12: As I said before... be careful in those abandoned buildings, Traveller. Do not lose yourself in the hunt.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_12: I will wait until you are ready, Traveller.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_DESC_12: The technician requires more <SPECIAL>Nanite Clusters<> to create an upgrade for my <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Signal Booster<>.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_LANG_12: You will find Nanite Clusters in abandoned structures, Traveller! Grah! Do not return to your former incompetence, I beg you...
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_12: Do you have the Nanite Clusters? Give them to me, please...
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_DESC_12:
The technician's hands shake. It is then that I notice the blueprint is already waiting on the technician's terminal...

They require these Nanite Clusters for some alternative purpose. They are desperate for the substance, refusing to hand over the blueprints without them.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_12:
The Vy'keen takes them greedily, turning to imbibe them. Whatever effect this matter has upon the alien, it appears to calm their movements considerably.
Sated, they offer me the blueprints.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_12: Grah! Give them to me, interloper! You will give them to me!
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_13:
The Nanite Clusters... their purpose is commonly misunderstood. They form the backbone of much technology, but they are not just machines.
They can alter hearts... alter minds... even allow us to forget that which we cannot bear.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_13: The technician has a final reward: an <TECHNOLOGY>Acceleration Module<> upgrade for my Nomad Exocraft, once I have constructed its Geobay.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_A_13: Good. Let me know when the Nomad Geobay is built. Grah! I cannot wait to witness its glory...
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RES_B_13: Return when you are ready, then. I will be here.
data.NPC_EXO_BRIEF_RET_DESC_13: The technician has a final reward: an <TECHNOLOGY>Acceleration Module<> upgrade for my Nomad Exocraft, once I have constructed its Geobay.
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_LANG_13: Grah! Does my work mean so little that you tarry like this? Go! Build the Nomad Geobay!
data.NPC_EXO_WAIT_DESC_13:
There are few in my travels that I have grown to understand as individuals, but this Vy'keen has shown me purposes, secrets I did not know existed in this universe.
They have shown me the promise of a different future, of a time of strife and glory.
The technician has struggled their entire life to achieve their goal of finding Nal's testament. What I head towards, I do not know.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_LANG_13:
Our work is almost concluded, but every end is a beginning...
I am too weak to travel as I once did, too tired to continue my pilgrimage. With your leave I shall remain here to stand by your side against your enemies. Grah! Woe betide those who would transgress against us!
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_DESC_13: The technician offers me the final <TECHNOLOGY>Acceleration Module<> upgrade.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_A_13: It has been a pleasure working with you, Traveller. Return when you are ready. I have a proposition for you... a lucrative and repeatable venture.
data.NPC_EXO_COMP_RES_B_13: It will be here, waiting for you.
data.NPC_EXO_TERM_LANG:
LOADING TRANSMISSION... DECRYPTING SUBSPACE FREQUENCY... ERROR. INTERCEPTION.
Witness the price of your heresy, fugitive of the Vy’keen. 

Know that there is no sky in which we cannot find you, no system to which you might flee unscathed. Hide, then, in the depths of this galaxy. For we are patient. 

Know that your spawn wept like mewling Gek as we cut them down. That we killed your consort as it fled, leaving the others behind to suffer. Where shall you ever find peace, knowing these things?
data.NPC_EXO_TERM_RES_A:
The message is not what I expected. The technician told me to retrieve a transmission from their family, but this... I must return and decide what to do.
Before the transmission closes, I pull the <TECHNOLOGY>Exocraft Mining Laser<> blueprint from the network.
data.NPC_EXO_TERM_WAIT_DESC: The terminal has nothing more to show me. Whoever intercepted this transmission left no trace...
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_DESC:
I approach the monolith. I am engulfed in its terrible truth. I see its words in the text of a thousand tongues, in the ephemera of countless stars.

I witness events that occurred millennia before my awakening...

I see two Vy'keen standing before a red glow, asking it of the universe. 

I see a Gek and a Korvax, waiting side by side before me. And before the vision ends, I see a vision of something I have not seen before. Of something that does not belong in this or any place. Of hatred, grief, despair. 

Of something that is yet to come...

I see the end of time, the end of all things. And in that crimson light, there is a figure, its hand held out before eternity...

I see all this, and then it is over. The monolith has nothing more to show me.
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_DESC1: I approach the monolith. I am engulfed in its terrible truth. I see its words in the text of a thousand tongues, in the ephemera of countless stars.
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_DESC2:
I witness events that occurred millennia before my awakening...
I see two Vy'keen standing before a red glow, asking it of the universe.
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_DESC3:
I see a Gek and a Korvax, waiting side by side before me. And before the vision ends, I see a vision of something I have not seen before. Of something that does not belong in this or any place. Of hatred, grief, despair.
Of something that is yet to come...
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_DESC4:
I see the end of time, the end of all things. And in that crimson light, there is a figure, its hand held out before eternity...
I see all this, and then it is over. The monolith has nothing more to show me.
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_LANG:
Know that I heard the word of the Atlas where Hirk had heard nothing. 

In their rage, in their impotent jealousy, Hirk struck me from the mountain and I saw the truth of what the Monolith had said. 

That my end would be an awakening. That in this dream, nothing should perish...

Or so it would be until the coming of the last Traveller. So it would be until the destruction of realities. Know this, the final testament of Nal...
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_LANG1: Know that I heard the word of the Atlas where Hirk had heard nothing.
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_LANG2: In their rage, in their impotent jealousy, Hirk struck me from the mountain and I saw the truth of what the Monolith had said.
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_LANG3: That my end would be an awakening. That in this dream, nothing should perish...
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_LANG4: Or so it would be until the coming of the last Traveller. So it would be until the destruction of realities. Know this, the final testament of Nal...
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_RES_A:
I leave, shaken by my experience. As I go, I feel something right behind me, breathing, watching... 

When I turn it is gone.
data.NPC_EXO_MONO_WAIT_DESC: The Monolith stands vacant, without hope of further prophecy. I have obtained all that I can.
data.NPC_EXO_FINAL_DESC:
The technician has hacked a terminal to siphon its units; if I get to the location fast enough, I will be able to transfer the units to my account.

They spend their days doing this now, tending to the Exocraft and drawing data from interplanetary networks. Sometimes I see them walking out into the planet itself to explore, but such times are rare. 

The technician is content with this retirement, engaging in its fugitive activity for the pleasure of the chase, no longer for the necessity of survival. It is a game we can repeat, one last heist after one last heist...
data.NPC_EXO_FINAL_LANG: Traveller, I have detected a location of monetary interest! Go, that you may hone your control of the Exocraft! Track the signal down before it disappears, so that we may siphon its units!
data.NPC_EXO_LOOP_RES_B: Grah! I do not know why I bother...
data.NPC_EXO_LOOP_DESC: The technician has hacked a terminal to provide me with a small number of siphoned units; if I get to the location fast enough, I will be able to claim them.
data.NPC_EXO_LOOP_WAIT_LANG: Traveller, why have you not yet reached the marker? Go, that you may hone your control of the Exocraft! Track the signal down before it disappears, so that we may siphon its units!
data.NPC_EXO_TERM_LOOP_DESC: The terminal whirs into action, spitting out errata in its confusion, siphoning funds from an intergalactic transaction directly into my account.
data.NPC_EXO_TERM_LOOP_RES_A:
As I go, I think to myself how glad I am that my technician can hack these networks.
They claim they can do this a thousand times and not be caught by any authorities. I hope that my fugitive friend is right...
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_1: Friend! You have work for me, yes? I have served in the finest kitchens and gardens across twelve systems, in each one producing prize-winning cuisine. I grow all my own ingredients! Hire me, yes?
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_1:
The Gek chirps happily at the sight of me. They promise to help me grow all kinds of crops on my world; the required paperwork has already been signed, apparently.

The Farmer offers to join my world and make use of my <TECHNOLOGY>Agricultural Terminal<>.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_A_1: Thank you, friend! Neither you nor your stomach shall regret it.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_B_1: But friend, the contract is already signed. My arrival is inevitable.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RET_LANG_1: Do you not tire, Traveller? Nature's yoke drags you down. I shall help you master it!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RET_DESC_1: The Farmer offers to join my world and make use of my <TECHNOLOGY>Agricultural Terminal<>.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_LANG_1: Tell me Traveller, does your homeworld have plentiful light? Is the soil bountiful, the air rich in oxygen?
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_A_1: Oh, friend, what joy! I shall grow such produce!
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_B_1: No matter, we shall make our own! Each crop has its quirks, its needs, and we shall tailor our home to them all.
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_LANG_1: This is a home of glass and metal, Traveller. It is in dire need of my touch. But no need to fear, for I come well equipped for such work!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_2:
Your first lesson will teach you to embrace the dirt, friend! The earth provides life in death, after all. 
Take this <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>, and these <TRADEABLE>Coprite Flower<> seeds. Grow the flower, and see how fine it feels to produce life!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_2: %NAME% is already bedding in nicely. They have already given me the means to beautify my home. If I prove myself a worthy farmer with this <TRADEABLE>Coprite Flower<>, perhaps they will share more of their agricultural secrets.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_A_2: Wonderful, my friend! Soon our home will be filled with the delicate perfume of Coprite!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_B_2: Very well, friend. But know the nature of my contract requires your participation.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RET_DESC_2: %NAME% wishes for me to use the <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<> to grow a <TRADEABLE>Coprite Flower<>.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_LANG_2: My parents wanted me to be a SalesGek, just as they were. As all three hundred of their other offspring were. But my passion is for the earth, for the taste and smell of its bounty! Why were we Gek born with this palate if not to use it?
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_A_2: Friend, the life of a Gek is not easy. I wish no disrespect to my siblings; they shoulder the burden of Balaron's history and make our Lords proud... But it is not a life for me. I make amends in my own way.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_B_2: Friend, plants are the most inspiring of beings! They care not for profit or war, they know nothing of us or our worries. And yet they provide us with so much, our existences bound together!
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_LANG_2: How is the <TRADEABLE>Coprite Flower<>, friend? Does it blossom? Is it heavy with 'fruit'?
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_RES_A_2: Beautiful, friend. We shall make a farmer of you yet. While I prepare a dish of fragrant coprite, another agricultural challenge awaits you!
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_RES_B_2: You must not delay the harvest, friend. It would be most unwise.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_3: The <TRADEABLE>Frostwort<> is a tricky thing, friend. It flourishes where other plants fail, thrusting its roots through the ice and snow. But such a hard life is not for us! Plant one here, in your own home, and be spared the pain of winter.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_3: %NAME% asks me to grow a <TRADEABLE>Frostwort<> plant, and prove our hydroponic system can replicate any environment.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_A_3: Wonderful, friend! It is a delicate thing to look at, for such a hardy plant. Please do enjoy it.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_B_3: Oh, friend. Have I not inspired you?
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RET_DESC_3: %NAME% is keen for me to grow a <TRADEABLE>Frostwort<> plant, and prove our hydroponic system can replicate any environment.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_LANG_3: There is quite a collection of lifeforms here. But very few of them are flora. I am so pleased that is changing!
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_DESC_3: The Farmer has made themselves at home in my base. They seem to have made a particular friend in the Overseer, preparing them a parade of strange dishes.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_A_3: Your Overseer is very wise, friend. They arranged my contract, and they treat me most kindly.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_B_3: It brings me great pleasure to cook, friend! I grow the plants, I eat the plants, and in death I shall feed the plants in return.
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_LANG_3: You have mastered the <TRADEABLE>Frostwort<>? Your base is already feeling more homely, yes?
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_RES_A_3: Does the way it shimmers in the light not enchant you, friend? I have lost hours to its gentle glisten! But now, a plant of great contrast.
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_RES_B_3: Do not be wary, friend. The joy of a great bounty is only amplifed by sharing it with others.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_4: Your next crop will be <TRADEABLE>Solar Vine<>, a plant that grows deep within the mantle of scorched worlds. It seeks out all heat, from the sun or the core below. Its roots can extend to such incredible lengths that once it was believed they never ended. But do not worry, friend! Here, with our facilities, their growth shall be more manageable.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_4: %NAME% wishes for me to cultivate <TRADEABLE>Solar Vine<>, a plant that usually grows only in extreme heat.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_A_4: If only I shone as brightly as the <TRADEABLE>Solar Vine<>... I envy you the joy of discovery, friend!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_B_4: Are you sure, friend? Their light is so beautiful...
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RET_LANG_4: I knew that you would see the light, friend.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RET_DESC_4: %NAME% wishes for me to cultivate <TRADEABLE>Solar Vine<>, a plant that usually grows only in extreme heat.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_LANG_4: You come into contact with many species, friend! Which do you like most? Gek, yes? The Vy'keen kill. The Korvax study. Only the Gek create!
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_A_4: Ah! Excellent answer, friend! You are very wise.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_B_4: Really? You do know that the Korvax are merely machines, friend? Your preference puzzles me.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_C_4: You choose those warrior brutes over your Gek friends? You surprise me, Traveller!
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_RES_D_4: Ah! A diplomatic response. Do not worry, friend! I think I know your true preference!
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_LANG_4: You have successfully cultivated <TRADEABLE>Solar Vine<>, yes? I can smell its heat from here, its incandescent splendour...
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_RES_A_4: Wonderful! Savour this moment, friend, for now I lead you into a more dangerous realm of botanical study...
data.NPC_FARMER_COMP_RES_B_4: Take a moment, return to your garden and tend to it, Traveller. That is all any of us can ever do.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_LANG_5:
<TRADEABLE>Fungal Clusters<> are cultivated within toxic environments, but you have proved you can master much, yes?
Be careful as you work, friend! Clusters have been known to cause illness and hallucination if improperly handled. Extended exposure is ill-advised!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_MAIN_DESC_5: %NAME% wishes for me to use the <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<> to grow <TRADEABLE>Fungal Clusters<>.
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_A_5: Wonderful! While you prepare the <TRADEABLE>Fungal Clusters<>, I will check our ventilation systems. One can have too much of a good thing!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RES_B_5: Oh, I am sorry, friend. Have I made the <TRADEABLE>Fungal Clusters<> seem too worrisome? You have nothing to fear, safe in your suit!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RET_LANG_5: Do not be afraid, friend! No-one ever died from <TRADEABLE>Fungal Clusters<>! Well, not often. But you will be fine, I am sure of it!
data.NPC_FARMER_BRIEF_RET_DESC_5: %NAME% wishes for me to use the <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<> to grow <TRADEABLE>Fungal Clusters<>.
data.NPC_FARMER_WAIT_LANG_5:
Did you know that Nanite Clusters sometimes resemble the Fungal Clusters? Nanite spores arrange themselves in accordance with some arcane purpose when left in the wild. Abandoned structures pulsate with their seething mass, lurching out from derelict terminals...
Nature precedes technology... I wonder... what does this universe inspire in you, friend? I -
