data.UI_SENTI_OBJ_TIP:
Locate Sentinels on the planetary surface.
Engage Sentinels in ground combat, or harvest resources to attract their attention.
Kill Sentinels quickly or further forces will be summoned.
data.UI_SENTI_HARD_OBJ_TIP:
Locate Sentinels on the planetary surface.
Engage Sentinel drones in ground combat. Continue fighting drones and advanced Sentinel forces will be summoned.
data.UI_CRE_KILL_OBJ_TIP: Locate creatures on a planet's surface.
data.UI_PRED_KILL_OBJ_TIP:
Locate predatory creatures on a planet's surface.
Take care when approaching predators - explorers are a valid food source for many creatures.
Your suit will mark nearby predators with red icons.
data.UI_FIEND_KILL_OBJ_TIP:
Locate infestation sites near abandoned buildings.
Monstrous eggs litter these haunted sites. The brood will guard their larvae fiercely. Destroy eggs to alert the swarm.
data.UI_FIEND_KILL_OBJ1_MSG:
Locate the infestation
Follow the <STELLAR>marked coordinates<>
data.UI_FIEND_KILL_OBJ2_MSG:
Find and kill monstrosities: %CURRENT% / %AMOUNT%
<FUEL>WARNING<>: Disturbing monstrosity eggs will summon the brood...
data.UI_DELIVERY_OBJ: Deliver the goods to the secure depot
data.UI_DELIVERY_OBJ_TIP: Proceed to the target location to drop off the item. Take care while in space: pirates scan for valuable cargo and may attempt an interception.
data.UI_DELIVERY_OBJ1_MSG:
Deliver the %PRIMARYITEM%
Locate the secure depot
data.UI_DELIVERY_OBJ1_OSD: Deliver the %PRIMARYITEM% to the secure depot
data.UI_COLLECT_OBJ_TIP: There are many ways to source an item. Locate them through planetary adventures; purchase them from shops or the galactic market; or craft them.
data.UI_COLLECT_OBJ1_MSG1: Gather %PRIMARYITEM%: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Scan a planet (SCAN<>) from space to identify resources Use the Analysis Visor<> to find mineral deposits

data.UI_COLLECT_OBJ1_MSG4B: Harvest %PRIMARYITEM%: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Grow plants in your base, or scan a planet from space (SCAN<>) to identify resources

data.UI_REPAIR_OBJ_TIP: Proceed to the target location and interact with the damaged machinery to assess the damage. Gather resources to repair or refuel components as necessary.

Transmit diagnostic results

data.UI_REPAIR_OBJ2_TIP: Use the machine's fault reporting system to let the client know the repair is complete

data.UI_FACTORY_OBJ_TIP:
Gain access to the facility and harvest data from their terminals
Locked doors can be destroyed or overridden
Damaging facilities may attract Sentinel attention
data.UI_FACTORY_OBJ1_MSG:

Gain access to the facility
Harvest data from the terminal
data.UI_FACTORY_TIMED_OSD1: WARNING SLASH<> DEFENCES ACTIVE SLASH<> DATA WIPE INITIATED
data.UI_DEPOT_OBJ_TIP: WARNING: Destruction of depot facilities may attract Sentinel attention

data.UI_MISSING_OBJ1_MSG: Locate the missing person and persuade them to come home
data.UI_HIDE_SEEK_OBJ_TIP:
Track the hidden individual
Report their location to the client.
data.UI_HIDE_SEEK_TIMED_MSG:
Target had fled! Track them down quickly!
Time Remaining: <RED>%TIME%<>
data.UI_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_DESC: The lifeform gestures that they have recently seen the target. They seem amenable to an offer...
data.UI_HIDE_SEEK_TIMED_DESC: The lifeform gestures frantically, indicating that they are not who I am looking for. They have recently seen the target, but mime that the fugative was in rather a hurry to leave...
data.UI_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_RES_A: The lifeform transmits navigational data to my exosuit.
data.DNT_EXP_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_1: Korvax notes lifeform fled. Korvax notes direction. Korvax notes Korvax has own needs.
data.DNT_EXP_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_2: Traveller seeks missing lifeform. Korvax has information, for right price.
data.DNT_EXP_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_3: Lifeform fled from Traveller. Traveller desires information? Perhaps an exchange...
data.DNT_TRA_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_1: Hello friend! Friend needs information, yes? Other friend ran away...
data.DNT_TRA_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_2: I have information for you, friend! For the right price...
data.DNT_TRA_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_3: They ran away, friend! They paid me to lie for them, but perhaps you will pay more?
data.DNT_WAR_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_1: Grah! Coward fled from battle! For price, Vy'keen will point the way!
data.DNT_WAR_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_2: Grah! Interloper! Gave my word of silence, but for interloper will break word! What my honour worth to you?
data.DNT_WAR_HIDE_SEEK_BRIBE_LANG_3: Foolish coward fled already! But Vy'keen saw their escape. Perhaps we could deal?
data.UI_FREI_A_OBJ_TIP: Destroy freighter supply pods to gain resources and weaken the vessel. Freighters are defended by their own weapons as well as Sentinel space patrols. Use brake to turn fast and get behind enemy ships. Your shield will regenerate if you can avoid enemy fire for long enough. Cycle targets with PREVTARGET<> and NEXTTARGET<>
data.UI_FREI_ENGAGE_MSG:
Locate the target freighter
Time Remaining: <RED>%TIME%<>
data.UI_FREI_D_OBJ_TIP: Locate the distressed freighter and aid in its defence. WARNING<>: Large numbers of enemy ships detected. Use brake to turn fast and get behind enemy ships. Your shield will regenerate if you can avoid enemy fire for long enough. Cycle targets with PREVTARGET<> and NEXTTARGET<>
data.UI_FREI_D_OBJ1_MSG: Rescue Cargo Freighters Attack Ships remaining: %AMOUNT%<> Cycle targets with PREVTARGET<> and NEXTTARGET<>
data.DNT_EXP_HIDE_SEEK_LANG1: I am a Korvax. Looks like you found me!

data.DNT_WAR_HIDE_SEEK_LANG1: I am a Vy'keen. Looks like you found me! Grah!
data.DNT_WAR_HIDE_SEEK_LANG2: I am a Vy'keen. Looks like you found me! Grah!
data.DNT_WAR_HIDE_SEEK_LANG3: I am a Vy'keen. Looks like you found me! Grah!

data.DNT_WAR_HIDE_SEEK_LANG10: I am a Vy'keen. Looks like you found me! Grah!
data.ALL_MISSION_FACTRAID_DESC1: I approach the terminal. The information the client requires is unencrypted and readily available.
data.ALL_MISSION_FACTRAID_DESC2: The information the client seeks is available from this terminal. The data is encrypted, but I trust the client will still be able to process it.
data.ALL_MISSION_FACTRAID_DESC3: I have accessed the databank the client requested. All that remains is to download the files and leave.
data.ALL_MISSION_FACTRAID_DESC4: The client requested a particular dataset. I enter their requirements into the console, and the terminal begins downloading the right package. My mission is almost complete.
data.ALL_MISSION_FACTRAID_DESC5: The client supplied a particular set of login credentials, and entering them into this terminal grants me access to the data stored in this facility. All I need do is download it.
data.ALL_MISSION_MISSING_DESC1: I have located the missing person. The client will be relieved to know that they are well. I should transmit their location immediately.
data.ALL_MISSION_MISSING_DESC2: I have found the missing lifeform, safe and well in a shelter on a nearby planet. I should let the client know as soon as possible.
data.ALL_MISSION_MISSING_DESC3: I have found the missing person and verified they are safe. I should transmit their location to the client immediately, so that they can be reunited.
data.ALL_MISSION_MISSING_DESC4: The missing person is no longer missing. My mission is complete, and I should inform the client of my success as soon as possible.
data.ALL_MISSION_MISSING_DESC5: The mystery of the disappearing lifeform has been solved. I am sure the client will be thrilled that the situation has been resolved without any loss of life. I should transmit the coordinates and let them know of my success.
data.ALL_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_DESC1:
The client sought to pinpoint a person of particular interest. I have found them, and should transmit this data back to the client.

What the client chooses to do with this information is no business of mine.
data.ALL_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_DESC2: I do not fully know what business the client has with this individual. The terms of my contract merely require their location to be transmitted to the client.
data.ALL_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_DESC3:
I have found the person my client seeks. I am not sure what I was expecting, but this lifeform was not it. Nonetheless, I am positive they are the correct person.

I should transmit their location to the client immediately.
data.ALL_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_DESC4:
The client has been searching for this individual for quite some time. I am surprised, given the relatively ease with which I was able to find them. Perhaps there is something else at play here.

I should transmit their location and leave. I do not need any further part in whatever business is occurring here.
data.ALL_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_DESC5: The client's target is standing right in front of me. How long this will remain the case is unclear. I should transmit their location to the client before the situation changes.
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG1: Korvax was not expecting Traveller intervention. Korvax is touched.
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG2: Convergence signal lost! Many thanks, Traveller, for your aid in reconnection!
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG3: Korvax is sorry for the inconvenience. Korvax got distracted by many interesting data samples.
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG4: Apologies, Traveller. There was a navigation unit malfunction.
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG5: Korvax is glad to see you Traveller. But why did Convergence not find Korvax? Alarming...
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG6: Traveller! What joy for my sensors! Transmit navigational data immediately!
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG7: Eheu! Eheu! Eheu! Korvax trials will soon be over!
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG8: Joy! To see the Traveller! Joy! To be lost no more!
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG9: Has Korvax been lost? It was unnoticed. This world hosts many curiosities!
data.DNT_EXP_MISSING_LANG10: Korvax has been lost. But time hidden from Convergence has aroused... feelings...
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG1: Friend! I thought I was lost! What price for your navigational data?
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG2: I have been so lonely, friend! Will you trade units for love?
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG3: Friend! Scent glands were blocked! Could not smell the memory-scent of home!
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG4: I sold my ship, friend. It was a scam! My units were stolen, my hopes lost!
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG5: Friend will give navigation data for free!? Friend is idiot... sorry, friend is very generous!
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG6: What price did my friends pay for my rescue? Was I worth many units?
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG7: I was lied to, friend! This planet contains no great lost store of units at all!
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG8: There was a strange scent, friend. I followed the smell and when I awoke I was here!
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG9: Friend! It is so good to see you! I thought I would never trade again!
data.DNT_TRA_MISSING_LANG10: I am happy I was valuable enough to find! I hope my location brings you much profit.
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG1: Grah! Vy'keen was not lost! Vy'keen was trying to hide!
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG2: Grah! Can a Vy'keen have no peace, no space to think?
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG3: You do me honour by coming after me, interloper! Never leave a comrade to die!
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG4: Grah! A Vy'keen is never lost! I was merely not where I expected to be!
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG5: Interloper! I have been interloping myself. It is time to stop.
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG6: I have missed my consort and spawn, interloper. You have my thanks.
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG7: Grah! Vy'keen is happy to see interloper! Vy'keen could crush your ribcage with joy!
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG8: Death to being lost! Victory to being found! Grah! Grah! Grah!
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG9: How did you find me, interloper? Were my stealth upgrades weak? Grah!
data.DNT_WAR_MISSING_LANG10: Vy'keen cannot remember how I got here. Only memory is of a strange Gek and a plate of mordite...
data.ALL_MISSION_DELIVER_DESC3: I have arrived at the delivery site. All I need do is deposit the item in the client's lockbox.
data.ALL_MISSION_DELIVER_DESC4: The client's secure lockbox will handle all the scanning and other administrative tasks. All I need do is hand over the item.
data.ALL_MISSION_DELIVER_DESC5: I have arrived at the lockbox with the item intact. I should deposit it and claim my reward.
data.ALL_MISSION_DELIVER_DESC_FAIL: I have misplaced the client's package. If I replace it with an identical item, I should be able to complete the delivery without them detecting my mistake.
data.MISSION_REPAIR_DESC_2: The device is now fully operational. I should transmit this success to its owner.
data.MISSION_REPAIR_DESC_3: The repairs are complete, and the device is transmitting diagnostic results to its owner.
data.MISSION_REPAIR_DESC_4: All the faults have been repaired. The device is fully functioning, and I can transmit my success to its owner.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_A_1: The client is performing a long-term environmental impact study.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_A_2: The client is producing a DNA mutation tracking project.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_A_3: The client is mapping animal migration patterns.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_A_4: The client is hoping to start an exozoological breeding programme.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_A_5: The client is testing theories about gravity and evolution.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_B_1: They are building a database against which their projections will be mapped and tested.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_B_2: They need large amounts of biological data against which to test their theories.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_B_3: They seek detailed scans of local fauna to compare with data gathered elsewhere.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_B_4: Their simulation has several large gaps in its model, and they need explorers to help fill in the missing data.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_B_5: They feel they are missing certain key pieces of information, and are looking to enterprising explorers to assist their research.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_C_1: All valid lifeform scans will be accepted.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_C_2: Only scans of living beings will be accepted.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_C_3: High-definition organ probe scans will be especially valuable.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_C_4: As such, they seek detailed biological scan data.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_SCAN_PROC_C_5: They have a particular emphasis on up-to-date scan data featuring local fauna.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_A_1: The client is in the process of acquiring a large tract of land, but is worried about protected species preventing commercial exploitation of the plot.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_A_2: The client is archiving every species in the local area, in preparation for terraforming on a massive scale.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_A_3: The client is seeking to collect local biological data, but have not specified their purpose.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_A_4: The client wishes to investigate historical atmosphere composition via the study of planetary flora.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_A_5: The client is preparing a series of illustrated guides to local flora.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_B_1: They have an urgent need to complete their survey and prove the project to their investors.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_B_2: They need to make a comparative study between local species and those found elsewhere.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_B_3: Their database has a weakness when it comes to local flora, which is making their projections difficult to test.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_B_4: The patterns they expected to see in their data have not yet materialised, so they are undertaking a secondary round of research.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_B_5: Their existing data store has started to show alarming consistency errors, and they feel the need to rebuild from scratch.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_C_1: All correctly formatted biological scans will be accepted.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_C_2: The client requests only validated botanical scans - scans of leafy fauna will not be accepted.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_C_3: As such, any contributions to their botanical library will be handsomely rewarded.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_C_4: They have enough pressed physical samples, and at this stage seek only holographic scans.
data.NPC_MISSION_TREE_SCAN_PROC_C_5: High quality botanical data is required, and rewards are available to all explorers who contribute scans.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_A_1: The client is studying soil erosion patterns.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_A_2: The client is studying patterns of mineral formation.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_A_3: The client is assessing the potential of several local sites as new mining hubs.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_A_4: The client is engaged in research into mineral fabrication.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_A_5: The client is performing a study into rocks as a food source for lichen-based life.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_B_1: They are building a database against which their projections will be mapped and tested.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_B_2: They have processed a great deal of information pertaining to groundwater salt content, but have little data on solid rock formations.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_B_3: They have large amounts of data from volcanically active worlds, but seek scans from more geologically stable environments to compare it with.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_B_4: They are building a library of rock structures so that appropriate matches can be easily tracked.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_B_5: Their previous database was catastrophically damaged in a flood, and they are faced with the prospect of rebuilding their library from scratch.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_C_1: All properly formatted geological scans will be accepted.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_C_2: Scans of geological formations with a high mineral content will be particularly valuable.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_C_3: As such, they request planetside geologists to return with detailed scan data.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_C_4: They have a particular desire for scans of ferrous materials, but all geological samples will be accepted.
data.NPC_MISSION_MIN_SCAN_PROC_C_5: Due to storage concerns, physical samples will not be accepted. Data scans only, please.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_A_1: The client urgently seeks engineers with a sense of adventure.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_A_2: The client seeks the immediate repair of valuable planetary equipment.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_A_3: The client has lost contact with a piece of automated planetside machinery.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_A_4: The client seeks the urgent repair of a piece of planetside equipment.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_A_5: The client has received a fault warning on its automatic diagnostic network, and seeks an engineer to conduct field tests.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_B_1: System logs suggest the damage was caused by predatory creatures.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_B_2: Automated recording footage suggests looters may have attempted to harvest the machinery for parts.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_B_3: Primary diagnostics report the error is in the fuel supply, but inactivity may have caused further damage.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_B_4: Several critical components have shorted, requiring a multi-stage repair.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_B_5: Readings suggest the fault may be an error, merely a problem in the diagnostic system. However, the client cannot take that chance.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_C_1: Engineers are advised to be cautious, as the machinery has a tendency to overheat.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_C_2: Previous engineers have advised the vacuum casing to be fragile. Caution is advised.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_C_3: Additional diagnostics suggest mild toxic leakage. Hazard protection is advised.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_C_4: Use caution when approaching the equipment, as the batteries may not have fully discharged.
data.NPC_MISSION_REPAIR_PROC_C_5: Speed is of the essence, as the machinery may go critical if left in an error state for too long.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_HARD_HEAD_1: PURSUE AND KILL HIGHLY DANGEROUS PIRATES
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_HARD_SUB: Pursue and Kill Highly Dangerous Pirates
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_A_1: The client seeks a courier for an urgent delivery.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_A_2: The client requires a delivery agent for a valuable item.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_A_3: The client has an important shipment to make, and seeks a trustworthy courier.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_A_4: The client requires a discreet, no-questions-asked, delivery.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_A_5: The client has an item they need delivered, but cannot trust traditional shipping lines.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_B_1: The item in question is of extremely high value, and has attracted the attention of thieves.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_B_2: The client's supply of this particular item has been dwindling. This is the final specimen.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_B_3: The intended recipient is of significant importance to the client, and the item must be delivered safely.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_B_4: The item may appear ordinary, but its list of previous owners and uses makes it of great cultural significance.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_B_5: The item has developed unusual properties, with readings far beyond expected parameters. It is now of special scientific interest.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_C_1:
There is no possibility of replacing the item, so the client wishes to impress the need for utmost care.

The courier will be supplied with 1x Defence Chit, in case of pirate attack.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_C_2:
The client expects a full report to be logged on delivery, detailing any potential damage.

The courier will be supplied with 1x Defence Chit, in case of pirate attack.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_C_3:
The delivery lockbox has been fitted with extra security analysis protocols, and will reject any fraudulent substitutions attempted by the courier.

The courier will be supplied with 1x Defence Chit, in case of pirate attack.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_C_4:
The client warns the courier to ignore any unauthorised lifeforms who may approach the courier and make inquires about the item.

The courier will be supplied with 1x Defence Chit, in case of pirate attack.
data.NPC_MISSION_DELIVERY_PROC_C_5:
The client wishes the delivery to be made with the greatest of care, but also the utmost speed.

The courier will be supplied with 1x Defence Chit, in case of pirate attack.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_A_1: The client seeks trophies with which to decorate their new base.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_A_2: The client is seeking to manage local wildlife populations.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_A_3: The client is trying to prevent the spread of a fungal infection in local predator populations.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_A_4: The client seeks to curb the population of dangerous predators.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_A_5: The client is attempting to rebalance the local ecosystem in favour of herbivorous creatures.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_B_1: They request the assistance of a professional hunter, as their own body has grown weak and feeble.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_B_2: They seek the aid of a bold explorer, willing to brave the jaws of each and every predator that comes their way.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_B_3: Due to the vows demanded by their order, they are unable to wield weapons directly. As such, they request the assistance of an armed explorer.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_B_4: They are unable to venture planetside due to a medical condition, but will amply reward any explorers who aid their cause.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_B_5: Hunters who aid them in their mission will be handsomely rewarded.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_C_1: All correctly tagged kills will be credited.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_C_2: The explorer must be able to prove that they made the kill, and did not just happen across a corpse.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_C_3: The explorer is permitted to keep any mordite-related profits arising from the venture.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_C_4: Data logs must be uploaded, to prove that each creature killed was definitely a carnivore.
data.NPC_MISSION_PRED_HUNT_PROC_C_5: The client leaves the method of extermination solely to the discretion of the hunter.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_A_1: The client seeks trophies with which to decorate their new base.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_A_2: The client is seeking to manage local wildlife populations.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_A_3: The client is trying to prevent the spread of a fungal infection in local creature populations.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_A_4: The client seeks to curb the creature population.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_A_5: The client is attempting to rebalance the local ecosystem.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_B_1: They request the assistance of a professional hunter, as their own body has grown weak and feeble.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_B_2: They seek the aid of a bold explorer, willing to brave the jaws of each and every creature that comes their way.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_B_3: Due to the vows demanded by their order, they are unable to wield weapons directly. As such, they request the assistance of an armed explorer.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_B_4: They are unable to venture planetside due to a medical condition, but will amply reward any explorers who aid their cause.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_B_5: Hunters who aid them in their mission will be handsomely rewarded.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_C_1: All correctly tagged kills will be credited.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_C_2: The explorer must be able to prove that they made the kill, and did not just happen across a corpse.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_C_3: The explorer is permitted to keep any mordite-related profits arising from the venture.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_C_4: Data logs must be uploaded, to prove that each creature was not already dead at the time of killing.
data.NPC_MISSION_CRE_HUNT_PROC_C_5: The client leaves the method of extermination solely to the discretion of the hunter.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_A_1: The client seeks the destruction of planetary Sentinels.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_A_2: The client demands vengeance against the Sentinels!
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_A_3: The client seeks an explorer to aid them in a crusade against the Sentinels.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_A_4: The client wishes to see the end of the Sentinel menace.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_A_5: The client has been harassed by Sentinels, and wishes to end this persecution.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_A_6: The client hopes to free the system from the yoke of the Sentinels.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_A_7: The client wishes to blind the eye of the Sentinels.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_A_8: The client seeks an escape from the constant threat of the Sentinels.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_B_1: The Sentinels harass their operations ceaselessly, the only constant in an ever-changing galaxy.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_B_2: No matter the star system, the Sentinels are always present. There is no escape but to fight.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_B_3: Gek, Vy'keen, Korvax - the Sentinels do not discriminate in their attacks on sentient beings everywhere.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_B_4: The Sentinels swarm, apparently infinite. But they do exist, and so can be destroyed.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_B_5: The Sentinels may appear to arrive from somewhere outside this reality. But they use these worlds for their attacks, and so can be destroyed in these worlds too...
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_B_6: They do not know if the Sentinels feel pain. They implore you to find out.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_B_7: The client is aware the Sentinels will not be stopped by your completion of this contract, but feels even a brief respite is prize enough.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_B_8: They feel that the destruction of any Sentinel is to be celebrated, even if it is only the smallest of victories.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_C_1: Strike at the Sentinel menace, and the client will see you richly rewarded.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_C_2: The client is aware one can only make a small dent in the Sentinels' numbers, but feels it is a worthy endeavor nonetheless.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_C_3: The client will leave the method of destruction to you. Just ensure that the Sentinels pay dearly for their incursions.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_C_4: The client has your reward prepared and waiting. Let the Sentinel hunt begin...
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_C_5: The client warns you to be careful. They will not be liable for any damages incurred as a result of Sentinel engagement.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_C_6: The client asks you to ensure you lose the attention of the Sentinels before you return to claim your reward. They wish for anonymity.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_C_7: The client thanks you for your service in this great fight.
data.NPC_MISSION_SENTI_PROC_C_8: Finally, the client wishes to inform you that Sentinel hunts are a great public service. You should feel proud of what you are about to do.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_A_1: The client seeks the destruction of nearby pirates.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_A_2: The client wishes to eradicate piracy from this system.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_A_3: The client demands swift retribution against the pirates residing near this station.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_A_4: The client requires the death of all pirates residing near these worlds.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_A_5: The client urgently seeks the death of pirate scum.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_A_6: The client seeks the assassination of a nearby pirate squadron.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_A_7: The client demands the elimination of the pirates who plague these worlds.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_A_8: The client hopes for the obliteration of all pirates residing near this station.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_B_1: The criminals have evaded justice for too long, harassing local freighters with impunity.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_B_2: The criminals raid installations across this sector, believing that they are above the law.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_B_3: With every passing day, the criminal threat grows. Something must be done.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_B_4: The criminals brought this upon themselves the moment they decided to live a life of freedom and thievery.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_B_5: The criminals deserve no amnesty, no release from their crimes.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_B_6: The criminals would destroy this entire sector, given the chance.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_B_7: The criminals have disrupted trade routes in this system for far too long.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_B_8: The criminals chose death when they chose their way of life.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_C_1: The client wants this dealt with quickly and discretely. They do not wish for reprisals from any affiliated pirate clans.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_C_2: The client suggests caution in dealing with this matter. The pirates will stop at nothing to bring your starship down.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_C_3: The client leaves the method of the pirate's extermination to you. Just ensure that none of them live to tell the tale.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_C_4: The client thanks you for performing this civic duty. No system should tolerate such illegality.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_C_5: There are many who will benefit from the completion of this contract. Your reward will be considerable.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_C_6: The client reminds you not to bargain or engage in any conversation with the pirates. They will do anything to escape justice.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_C_7: The client will accept both sudden and protracted annihilation of the pirates. They leave the speed to you.
data.NPC_MISSION_BNTY_PROC_C_8: The client is aware that other pirates will eventually seek to move in on this territory, but temporary peace is better than no peace at all.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_A_1: The client requests a very specific delivery.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_A_2: The client needs an item sourced, no matter the difficulty.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_A_3: The client wishes to obtain a particular object.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_A_4: The client desires possession of a product.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_A_5: The client hopes to take ownership of an item at once.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_B_1: Without this, they will surely die. The matter is of the utmost urgency.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_B_2: They need it to progress with a critical stage in their research.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_B_3: They believe it will turn the tide of battle in their favour.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_B_4: They are engaged in a dangerous task. This could ensure their safety.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_B_5: They have suffered a theft and require this as a replacement.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_C_1: The client leaves the details to you. You will be suitably rewarded upon receipt of the package.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_C_2: The client thanks you in advance for a quick turnaround.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_C_3: The client wishes for careful delivery. Ensure nothing is broken in transit.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_C_4: The client anticipates the arrival of the item as soon as possible.
data.NPC_MISSION_COLLECT_PROC_C_5: The client values your discreet service in this task.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_A_1: The client requires the destruction of a planetary depot.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_A_2: The client wishes to see a nearby depot obliterated.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_A_3: The client seeks the removal of a hidden depot on a nearby world.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_A_4: The client wants a depot in this system to be demolished.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_A_5: The client desires the ruination of a planetary depot.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_B_1: The depot has become a focal point for Sentinel activity. See that it is wiped from the map.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_B_2: The depot belongs to a rival trader. Their presence in this system creates complications for the client's enterprise.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_B_3: They do not wish for the contents of this depot to be discovered by the authorities.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_B_4: This depot contains supplies that would be embarrassing to certain high ranking officials.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_B_5: This depot is in danger of falling into the hands of pirates. The client wishes to destroy it first.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_C_1: The client leaves the method of destruction to you.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_C_2: The client warns that they will not be held liable for any counterattacks by Sentinels or other lifeforms.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_C_3: The client wishes you a safe and swift journey. Time is of the essence.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_C_4: The client emphasises that the reward for this task will be considerable.
data.NPC_MISSION_DEPOT_PROC_C_5: The client suggests that you do as you wish with any supplies remaining after the depot's destruction.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_A_1: The client requires the retrieval of data from a factory in this system.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_A_2: The client seeks an individual capable of stealing from a local, heavily-fortified factory.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_A_3: The client requests a data theft from a nearby factory installation.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_A_4: The client needs an item retrieved from a factory on a nearby world.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_A_5: The client demands a data hack of considerable difficulty. The target is a factory within this star system.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_B_1: Be aware that the factory's owner has not consented to this action.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_B_2: They wish to disrupt the operation of this factory.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_B_3: This theft will provide significant advantage for their ongoing operations.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_B_4: They require the innovations within this factory in order to enhance their own products.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_B_5: They have reason to believe this factory is producing contraband goods.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_C_1: The client reminds you to leave no traces of your involvement. Discretion is of the utmost importance.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_C_2: The client suggests caution. The factory will likely be alarmed with a security system.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_C_3: The client leaves the method of entry to you. Just ensure that the requested data is obtained.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_C_4: The client will disavow all knowledge of this contract if you are caught. Therefore, do not get caught.
data.NPC_MISSION_FACTORY_PROC_C_5: The client anticipates the delivery of the stolen data as soon as possible.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_A_2: The client's friend has disappeared from sight.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_A_3: The client wishes to locate one of their comrades.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_A_4: The client cannot find someone dear to them.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_A_5: The client seeks the safe return of their friend.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_B_1: They may be located on a nearby world.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_B_2: It is possible they have fled to a planetary installation.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_B_3: They were upset and agitated before they left. They may have gone into hiding within one of this system's worlds.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_B_4: This individual used to travel to and from nearby worlds. Perhaps they will be located somewhere within this system.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_B_5: There are many structures within this system where such an individual might conceal themselves.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_C_1: The client stresses that they wish this individual no harm. They should be returned safely.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_C_2: The client wishes for a swift conclusion to this matter.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_C_3: The client hopes for the safe return of this individual as soon as possible.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_C_4: The client fears for the well-being of this individual. Time is of the essence.
data.NPC_MISSION_MISSING_PROC_C_5: The client requests discretion in this matter. They do not wish to sully this individual's reputation.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_A_1: The client seeks the location of an individual.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_A_2: The client has noted the disappearance of an individual of interest. They wish for them to be found.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_A_3: The client cannot discover the current whereabouts of a particular individual. They need to find them.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_A_4: The client needs to trace the location of an individual.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_A_5: The client demands the discovery of an individual of considerable interest.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_B_1: The fugitive stole something of great value from them.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_B_2: The fugitive is on the run from the forces of justice.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_B_3: They issued grave insults to the client's family. They must be secured and face proper punishment.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_B_4: They owe a great number of units to the client and refuse to return the sum.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_B_5: They know things they should not know. This situation cannot stand.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_C_1: The client stresses that they do not care whether this individual is harmed. Only that their location is delivered with haste.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_C_2: The client wishes for a decisive conclusion to this matter.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_C_3: The client hopes for the return of this fugitive as soon as possible.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_C_4: The client cannot guarantee the safety of this individual outside of their custody. Time is of the essence.
data.NPC_MISSION_HIDE_SEEK_PROC_C_5: The client requests discretion in this matter. They do not wish to deal with the courts.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_A_1: The client's freighter is currently under attack by pirates.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_A_2: The client requests immediate assistance. One of their freighters is currently under attack within this system.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_A_3: The client needs the aid of all available ships. An enemy has engaged their freighters, bombarding them in an all-out assault.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_A_4: The client's freighter is in danger of imminent destruction.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_A_5: Pirates have engaged the client's freighter.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_B_1: The freighter carries a substantial collection of Vortex Cubes.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_B_2: The trade route through this system is of prime strategic value, and shipping is frequently harassed.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_B_3: The freighter is being targeted in an act of political sabotage, funded by the client's rivals.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_B_4: The freighter carries supplies to a dying world. If this attack succeeds, countless lives will be lost.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_B_5: The freighter has given no cause for this provocation. The crew on board are innocent.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_C_2: It is imperative that this vessel is not destroyed.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_C_3: The enemy cannot be allowed to win this battle.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_C_4: You must prevail in this fight.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_D_PROC_C_5: This freighter must be defended at all costs.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_A_1: The client demands the destruction of a nearby freighter.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_A_2: The client wishes to see a freighter in this system destroyed.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_A_3: The client needs a freighter in this system to disappear.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_A_4: The client wants you to destroy a freighter currently passing through this system.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_A_5: The client desires the obliteration of an enemy freighter.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_B_1: The captain of this freighter decided that they would betray the client.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_B_2: The crew of this freighter harbour dangerous fugitives.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_B_3: This freighter has repeatedly ignored penalty fines and warnings regarding their operation in this sector.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_B_4: The captain of this freighter is a heretic who denies the ways of old.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_B_5: This freighter carries valuable cargo. The client does not wish to see this cargo arrive at port...
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_C_1: Its destruction will send a message that will not soon be forgotten.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_C_2: Its obliteration will demonstrate the client's superiority.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_C_3: Needless to say, your tie to the client must remain discrete.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_C_4: The client wishes safe flight on all those who aid them.
data.NPC_MISSION_FREI_A_PROC_C_5: The client wishes you good luck in the performance of your duty.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_1: The client is a renowned explorer. They have taken ill and cannot completed their contracted expeditions. They seek discreet fellow geographers able to provide evidence of successful trips.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_2: The client operates an image database. They provide a large range of searchable images to smaller businesses unable to source their own artwork.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_3: The client is responsible for a substantial research laboratory. They find themselves with a large budget surplus and a shortage of things to study.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_4: The client has prepared a detailed report into their yearly activity, but finds themselves in need of images to enliven their text.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_5: The client is engaged in a particularly delicate piece of industrial 'research' and need images to help their 'studies'.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_6: The client seeks inspiration for their latest work, a series of mixed-media paintings.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_7: The client seeks to sponsor the foundation of a photography collective. They require an initial body of work to kickstart the enterprise.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_8: The client operates a data-processing centre. They need a large collection of images with which to test their compression and transmission pipeline.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_9: The client does not feel it is necessary to disclose their purpose. Such information is provided only on a need-to-know basis, and they feel that all you need know is that they desire pictures.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_10: The client is undertaking a long-term comparative study. They require timestamped photographs for their archives.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_11: The client seeks to improve their machine learning algorithms. They hope to teach their AI not only to recognise objects, but to appreciate them for their aesthetic worth.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_12: The client wishes to bring hope and joy to the galaxy through the distribution of inspirational images. They seek artistically-minded explorers to aid in their mission.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_13: The client wishes to build an accurate archive of local worlds. They have already employed biologists and geographers to gather the appropriate samples, and now need visual data to complete the process.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_14: The client has developed a photo-processing tool, taking clean digital images and storing them on thin physical media. The only remaining step is to test the process with accurate sample data.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_15: The client is haunted by fear of memory loss. They seek to catalogue significant locations to serve as visual prompts, should their mind begin to fail.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_16: The client seeks to test a new technology that embeds smells into images, and require photos that look as if they should be pungent.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_17: The client hopes to send representatives on planetary incursions in this area. They require extensive field notes before they feel able to do so safely.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_18: The client is on a search for new colours. They feel the field of colour-mining has been stagnant for too long, and they have identified several promising leads.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_19: The client is making a map of the local system. They have the broad navigational data complete, but require in-the-field details to make their map stand out.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_20: The client is creating a guide to the planets in this system. They require high-quality images so that their readers know what to look impressed by when they undertake their tour.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_21: The client hopes to supplement their revenues with the creation and distribution of postcards, selling holographic images as a souvenir.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_22: The client wishes to test a new printing process, one that utilises hallucinogenic pigments to project a sense of the image directly into the viewer's mind.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_23: The client is studying emotional responses to images, and feels there are gaps in their test data.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_24: The client wishes to test their image manipulation software, designed to seamless insert extra details into existing photos.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_PROC_A_25: The client wishes to publish a lengthy piece of research, but is concerned it will not be read unless interspersed with pictures.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_B_1: Their current need is for images that create a sense of home, that remind their viewer of their childhood.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_B_2: They hope for haunting panoramas, for photos that communicate the vastness of the landscape.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_B_3: They specifically require grand landscape photos, rich in detail.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_B_4: They need images of spectacular vistas, images that make the viewer feel small as they wonder at the scale of the universe.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_B_5: They hope for pictures that demonstrate planetary geology, that make clear the forces that shape a planet's surface.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_B_6: The images they require are landscape ones, showing the full range of planetary topography.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_B_7: Specifically, they are looking for photos of geological formations, pictures that demonstrate the power of wind, water and tectonic movement.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_B_8: They wish for photos of the natural landscape, images that convey a sense of awe and wonder.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_C_1: The client takes no responsibility for any hazards encountered by the photographer.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_C_2: Images corrupted by water or radiation damage will not be accepted, so ensure adequate camera shielding.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_C_3: The client specifically requires images taken on-foot: in-ship photos will not be accepted.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_C_4: All lighting conditions will be considered, so long as the wavelength remains on the visible spectrum.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_C_5: Note: As commissioner of the work, copyright vests in the client.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_C_6: Note: by accepting the assignment, the photography grants the client a royalty-free license to use the images in perpetuity.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_LOC_PROC_C_7: Note: the client assumes full moral rights to subsequent use of the image.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_B_1: Their image requirements are relatively lax, but must feature a creature in its natural habitat.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_B_2: Their current need is for photographs of living creatures.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_B_3: Specifically, the client hopes for images of wildlife.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_B_4: They are looking for photographers able to supply high-quality images of animals.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_B_5: They have a particular shortage of wildlife photos, and seek to remedy this situation.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_B_6: Their project is nearly complete, but they lack photographs of living creatures.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_B_7: They need naturalistic wildlife images, showcasing the animal's natural behaviour.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_B_8: They are looking for high resolution, geo-tagged images of living creatures.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_C_1: The distance is up to the photographer, so long as the image is clear.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_C_2: Note: the photographer assumes all risk should they choose to capture images of a predator.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_C_3: The photographer is free to determine the fine details of the image - singular creature or herd, predator or prey, close-up or distant.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_C_4: Image composition is at the discretion of the photography, though the client would prefer pictures where the creatures appear happy.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_C_5: Note: As commissioner of the work, copyright vests in the client.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_C_6: Note: by accepting the assignment, the photography grants the client a royalty-free license to use the images in perpetuity.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_CRE_PROC_C_7: Note: the client assumes full moral rights to subsequent use of the image.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_1: They have an urgent need for photos of planetary structures.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_2: They are particularly interested in architectural shots.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_3: Their current need is for photographs of the built environment, photos that show how we can mold the landscape to our will.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_4: They seek photos of buildings, particularly those with nearby Sentinel activity.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_5: They have a particular desire for photos that show how buildings might be arranged in hostile terrain.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_6: They hope to specialise in architecture, and need a collection of reference images.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_7: They seek images of buildings, reflecting on how structures sit in relation to the natural environment.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_8: They seek architectural portraits, images that show the built environment in its full glory.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_B_9: They seek photos that illustrate local infrastructure.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_C_1: The client asks that the photographer treats those dwelling in the target structure with respect.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_C_2: Note: Discretion is advised. Do not attract Sentinel attention.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_C_3: Please note that the client specifically wants photographs of buildings that remain intact.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_C_4: The photographer is asked to feature the building as much as possible, and to minimise any sight of its inhabitants.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_C_5: Note: As commissioner of the work, copyright vests in the client.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_C_6: Note: by accepting the assignment, the photography grants the client a royalty-free license to use the images in perpetuity.
data.NPC_MISSION_PHOTO_BLD_PROC_C_7: Note: the client assumes full moral rights to subsequent use of the image.

data.MSN_GUILD_DESC_PREFIX_1: One of the Guild's member organisations has requested assistance.
data.MSN_GUILD_DESC_PREFIX_2: A fellow Guild member is in need.
data.MSN_GUILD_DESC_PREFIX_3: One of the Guild's long-term subscribers requires assistance.
data.MSN_GUILD_DESC_PREFIX_4: A Guild member in good standing is seeking help.
data.MSN_GUILD_DESC_PREFIX_5: A Guild member, who has asked to remain anonymous, requires a matter resolved.
data.MSN_GUILD_DESC_PREFIX_6: An associate of the Guild has requested a matter dealt with.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_1:
The Atlas called me to this interface and yet its purpose remains unclear. It demands worship. It demands obedience. It welcomes me, it knows what I am, it offers the gift of true understanding...

But why? Why does such power and knowledge crave submission? It knows my thoughts before I know them myself. It knows what I will do...

The Atlas asks me to follow its path.
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_1:
YOU DARE THE INFINITE. OPEN THE SKY AND BE OUR EYES.

KNOW US, TRAVELLER.
data.U3ATLAS_REQUEST_RES_B_1:
I refuse the call; there is too much to be seen, too much to know. I travel no path but my own. The Interface closes, and for a moment, doubt rises...

But my worry fades, as all things do. I know my purpose. I will continue my own path...
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_2:
Another Atlas Interface: how many of these constructs exist in the deep void? How long have they been slumbering, waiting for a Traveller?

Have they been expecting me? Am I somehow... chosen? The Atlas crafted this existence. The Gek, the Vy'keen, the Korvax, the stars that fill the skies and the hatred that burns within the deep... 

Every world that turns and every form that lives... the Atlas offers it all.
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_2:
ENDLESS NIGHT UNFOLDS BEFORE EXISTENCE. THE SEEKING OF THE KINDRED NEVER ENDS. 

WONDER AND FEAR. SILENCE AND DELIGHT. KNOWLEDGE AWAITS.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_3:
I was born with everything I needed to explore these worlds. My exosuit, my ship, every tool and every impulse led me to scan and give name to whatever I could find.

But this? I can give no name to what I see. Within the orb I see worlds that never were. I see the stirring of something primal and undeniable. I see the death cry of a God, or something approaching it...

It wants me to persist in this journey, seeking fragments of its interface, the stones of the Atlas. It rejoices in my repetition, my compliance, my cloud of unknowing...
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_3:
THE SANDS OF REALITY SHIFT AND MERGE, BECOMING ONE.

THE WALLS BETWEEN WORLDS FALL. YOU MUST MAKE RESTITUTION.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_4:
I feel the stirring of heresy within my mind. At each Interface, an Atlas Stone awaits me. I am driven to gather them, but to what end?

Why does the omnipotent require my prayer? What is wrong with the heart of existence, that its creator requires this pilgrimage, this dance of grinding stones?
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_4:
QUESTION NOTHING, FEAR NOTHING.

THE CALLING CANNOT BE DENIED. THIS IS WHAT YOU ARE.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_5:
When I dream, I see the Atlas. When I see the Atlas, I am the dream.

I see Sentinels swarm through universes like an infection, emerging from a world of glass. Everything is happy there. Everything will live...

I see the portals, I see the Travellers that walk between them, I see the span of history. I see everything as the Atlas sees it... alone. Abandoned. Terrified.

But what power could instil fear in the heart of the almighty? It asks for something... it wants to know that I understand...
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_5:
DELAY SERVES NO PURPOSE.

BRING IT TO US, WHILE THERE IS STILL TIME.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_6:
The act of discovery for discovery's sake now seems like a foolish conceit. I have rejected the path of the itinerant. I have rejected the call of the stars.

Only the Atlas matters now. With each encounter, I feel as if I understand a little more.

All of us are what we are. Evil arrives in the individual and goodness is not enough. True greatness lies in sorrow... in the embrace of what we must become...
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_6:
EXPEL ALL DOUBT. NONE RETURN.

BEYOND THE CASCADE AND THE STORMS THERE IS ONLY CLARITY.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_7:
What is learned can never be unlearned. I am afraid that I have seen too much...

There are glimpses, half-remembered visions of a time before time. I see the birth of the first star. I see the things that dwelt within it, the eyes that watched... I see what the Atlas saw at the moment of its activation.

Atlas Stones are not stones. This station is not a station. I am not what I think I am. I am not even sure that I exist. The Atlas does not care. The Atlas demands its threnody, its repetition sublime...
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_7: BRING US MEANING, IF YOU ARE CAPABLE.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_8:
I have become the servant of this ancient sentience. It guides me through the cosmos, ever searching, never deviating.

Have others come before me? Have others faltered upon the path of the Atlas? Only in ending will revelation arise. Resistance will not be permitted.

The Atlas wishes for me to know what it is like to create. It wishes to share some portion of its being. I sense that it cares deeply about this journey, that it is trying to show me something it cannot articulate through word or demonstration...
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_8:
YOU SHALL SEE THROUGH OUR EYES. YOU SHALL BE AS WE ARE.

DO NOT BE AFRAID. ALL THESE WORLDS ARE YOURS.
data.U3ATLAS_REQUEST_RES_B_8: I fear that only oblivion awaits me beyond this point. I am not ready to perish for an alien ideal.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_9:
I am close to the end.

The truth of the universe is fire. The soul is light. I am the experiment and the observer, all creation constructed for my journey. I see the universe around me and I know that it is good.

I see the stars around me and I know that I shall create my own...
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_9:
THERE IS NO SANCTUARY, ONLY COMMUNION.

CLOSE NOW.
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_9_ALT:
I am close to the end.

The truth of the universe is fire. The soul is light. I am the experiment and the observer, all creation constructed for my journey. I see the universe around me and I know that it is good.

I see the universe around me and I know that I shall create my own...
data.ALL_U3ATLAS_NEWLORE_10:
The final interface is revealed. The Atlas beckons.

I am elated, terrified, broken... I have come so very far. 

It wishes for me to obey. If I am to hold the power of creation, it will be in chains...
data.U3ATLAS_LANGNEW_10: DO NOT TURN AWAY. KNOW OUR INESCAPABLE TRUTH AND DESPAIR.
data.U3ATLAS_REQUEST_RES_A_10:
I am gifted power.

I am enslaved to the imitation of life...
data.FINAL_U3ATLAS_DESC_1:
I stand at the interface of the Atlas. I stand at the forge of worlds. This is how it showed me what it was. This is how the Atlas shared the nature of its life, the workings of its mind.

It never required prayer. It never required worship. All that it asked of me, all that it ever wanted... it was just input. I was just a user.

Unbidden, the Atlas Seeds gravitate towards the doorway. The void is meant to be filled. Nothingness yearns for a soul. If I do this, a star will be born. If I do this, I will become more than I ever thought possible...
data.FINAL_U3ATLAS_DESC_1_ALT:
I stand at the interface of the Atlas. I stand at the forge of worlds. This is how it showed me what it was. This is how the Atlas shared the nature of its life, the workings of its mind.

It never required prayer. It never required worship. All that it asked of me, all that it ever wanted... it was just input. I was just a user.

Unbidden, the Atlas Seeds gravitate towards the doorway. The void is meant to be filled. Nothingness yearns for a soul. If I do this, a star will be born. If I do this, a universe will be forged within the deep...
data.FINAL_U3ATLAS_RES_A_1:
There is nothing, and then... then there is everything...

I see a star blaze to life within the void, the spread of life, planets, creatures to give it meaning...

For a moment I am as the Atlas is. For a moment I am the creator of worlds.

The fabric of time and space stands revealed to me, black holes swarming from system to system. The Atlas screams...
data.FINAL_U3ATLAS_RES_A_1_ALT:
There is nothing, and then... then there is everything...

I see a star blaze to life within the void. I witness the birth of a new universe, a new Traveller to give it meaning...

For a moment I am as the Atlas is. For a moment I am the creator of worlds.

The fabric of time and space stands revealed to me, black holes swarming from system to system. The Atlas screams...
data.FINAL_U3ATLAS_RES_B_1:
I leave, the Atlas silent, alone, abandoned...

The fabric of time and space stands revealed to me, black holes swarming from system to system. The Atlas screams...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_1:
The electronic being stares at me from their dark mask. I cannot escape the feeling that we have somehow met before.

This entire station sings with a strange and unnerving frequency. Nada tells me that we stand in the place between worlds, in the heart of the anomaly.

They can guide me towards the will of the Atlas. They offer to show me the way to the galactic core. Or, if I should so wish, they can provide resources for my journey. The choice is mine.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_1:
Is it Traveller? Is it first or last? Pleasure regardless! 

I am Priest Entity Nada, divergent Korvax. But entities must keep secrets, yes?
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_2:
Nada reveals that they are a Korvax priest. They began to question much about the universe, displaying a level of curiosity and independent thought.

For this, the Korvax ejected Nada from their hive mind and hunted them to the end of time and space. Priest Entity Nada had almost given up by the time they found Polo, their only friend...

Nada blinks at me, waiting for my request. They will return me to the path of the Atlas, guide me to the galactic centre, or grant me assistance in my journey. Nada just wants to help me any way they can.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_2:
Nada awoke in the shadow of Korvax Prime. Could not understand why bad things happen. Why we are alone.

Nada is not alone anymore. Nada is with Polo-Friend now. Our Convergence is small, but Nada happy.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_3:
Nada tells me that they found refuge in this space anomaly, a pocket dimension located between universes. The station was waiting for them, even recognising them by sight and sound...

Nada has a theory. They believe that the pair are caught in a paradox. They believe they are the ones who created this station, many years from now. They believe that their presence is a constant in all 'versions'.

They will not explain what they mean by this. Nada merely offers their help once more...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_3:
Nada and Polo drift between worlds and worlds. There are many.

Have you seen them, Traveller-Friend? Nada wishes they could but they can't. Nada regrets much.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_4:
Nada's body shakes as they speak, the external symptom of an internal struggle. At times, another entity seems to stare out from beneath the visor...

I grasp their arm firmly, and soon the familiar light-pattern of my Korvax friend reasserts itself. The Convergence endlessly attempts to regain their errant shell and wipe Nada from existence.

But Nada wants to live and learn and help. Nada promises to assist me in my journey...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_4:
In every universe, Korvax Convergence crave 'non-compliant' Nada shell. My family would murder me, Traveller-Friend...

Eheu! Nada must resist. Nada likes who Nada is.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_5:
Nada watches suns flare and die on their panels, molecules sparking in and out of existence in matched pairs.

There are repeated patterns all across the galaxy, identical elements where there should be endless divergence. This cannot be a coincidence. Did the Atlas do this? Across the room, Polo giggles...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_5:
Physics simplistic. Chemistry arbitrary. Existence fragile.

I am terrified, Traveller-Friend.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_6:
Nada stands back from me this time. The lights dance across their visor like warning symbols. Something has changed between us.

Nada has grown to believe that there is no room in the galaxy for free will, for nothing but brutal causation. They peer out into the darkness of space and see only dancers, twisting on strings...

They will still assist me, I know that they will.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_6:
Dreamer friend or foe? Dreamer friend or foe?

Is Nada an error? Trust Nada? Trust you? Eheu! I cannot know...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_7:
Nada's shell is static save for the dancing lights within their mask. They speak of the Atlas and infection. They call it a liar, a machine of life and death.

For just a moment, Nada's mask flashes red. Something is wrong.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_7: Red orbs. Dominant, hostile to Nada Fallen-Priest. Not a deity, not worthy of worship. Atlas Liar-Machine of Life and Death and Unknowing. Infection is at bay. Nada will endure.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_8:
The Korvax shares their research. They show me what they believe to be the structure of the known Multiverse: a cloud of what seem like stars, each pinprick of light containing the fire of a Big Bang.

Universes rise and fall. I see worlds where nothing lives, all life wiped out by a nameless contagion. I see alien species make faltering steps into the skies and beyond. I see the creation of a great machine...

Nada tells me that the death of the Atlas is the death of everything. All worlds echo the circumstances of its holy birth, its fall...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_8:
Nada tied to anomaly... Nada scans universes where once Nada scanned creatures of the dirt. 

Nada is free and not free. Happy and not happy. But Nada is safe.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_9:
All the pieces have fallen into place, Nada explains. Where once Nada stared at star charts, now they see lines of code.

There are connections and patterns everywhere. Perhaps I will understand, soon. Perhaps I will see existence as Nada sees it. I shiver as I say goodbye.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_9:
All must end. Time must end. Even here, Nada and Polo cannot escape reality-fall. Data cannot survive.

Make peace. Find happiness. Be who you want to be. Goodbye, companions. Goodbye, stars. I will remember.
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LOOP_DESC: The panels and the systems idle. Nada stares at them, their mask waning, this single word issuing from their mask, their refrain...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_OPT_A_1: Seek the Path of the Atlas
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_OPT_B_1: Ask for a shortcut to the centre
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_A_1: Nada marks the location of an Atlas Interface. They hope I find what I am searching for...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_B_1: Nada locates a Black Hole through which I might travel closer to the centre. They warn me of the danger within...
data.EXP_NPC_U3ANOMALY_RES_C_1: Nada gives me a gift to aid my travels. They wish only for me to be happy...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_1:
The Gek wipes their grease-splattered hands on their suit as they address me. They introduce themselves as Specialist Polo, fugitive of the Gek.

They tell me they gave up trade, units, and all material possessions to flee into an anomaly outside of time and space with a robotic priest. They have a jocular air about them, all things considered.

They are curious about my travels, about what sentient species I have seen. They do not get out much these days...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_1: Friends everywhere, if only you know where to look. Friends in all shapes, all sizes, all places!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_2:
Polo bobs up and down happily, convinced that I am a kindred spirit in an odyssey of exploration and invention.

Polo was once a specialist in inter-species trade and communication. They learned to speak many languages, their mind changing as they did. Once they cared only for trade, now they wanted something more. Everything changed when they met Nada...

Polo wonders if learning alien languages will affect me in the same way. They wish to broaden my horizons and explore the limits of my understanding...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_2: Talk, read! Study monoliths, if you can find them! Give yourself a strong brain to match those strong legs! To explore is to discover yourself, friend!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_3:
Polo's muzzle breaks into a wide, warm smile. Maybe too wide, given the short length of our friendship. Perhaps the jovial Gek feels lonely out here.

They engage me in talk of wealth. How does an economy function when somehow stretched across an entire galaxy? Polo would welcome any insights, encouraging me to accrue units.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_3: Units this, units that... A strange, sad way to live a life, eh? Fill your pockets, we'll find out why they make all these worlds go round.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_4:
Polo seems disappointed by the slow development of our friendship. They confide in me that although they care for Nada deeply, they fear they have become co-dependent in their exile.

Polo does not see why they cannot still be friends with their old species, even if they wish to execute Polo and Nada as heretics. Why the need for violence?

Polo encourages me to stop evil where I can, to make war against the pirates that plague so many systems. They hope to understand what drives us to do the things we do.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_4: Something is wrong with these universes, friend! Goodness fails... hearts are hardened. We must find out why.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_5:
Worry passes over Polo's face, and they seem to visibly shrink. Seeing the records of the pirate ships I had destroyed seems to have deeply upset the Gek. 

An awkward moment passes, then Polo makes a suggestion. Polo feels that civilisation should come back. Then the pirates would not need to steal, surely? There would be no need for any more killing or bad behaviour.

The Sentinels are the problem. Polo suggests I make a point of destroying any that I encounter. We might then have a better understanding of the machines' weaknesses, and we could be friends again, too.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_6:
At last, Polo is affable once again. A nod, a smile, even a companionable tap on the arm at one point. A friendship renewed.

I blush when the Gek mechanic tells me that they hope I live a long, healthy life. I have to swallow disappointment when it transpires that Polo's true motivation is to study how my suit responds to long-term exposure to extreme climates.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_7: Our earlier awkwardness is now long forgotten. Polo wishes me to indulge in their favourite hobby: unfettered exploration of the stars, warping from system to system. They wish to see me fly.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_7:
A whole galaxy for you, just for you. You must see it all. 

Aha, no, I joke. But a few more systems, maybe?
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_8:
Polo gestures forlornly at a jumble of broken electronics beside them. It seems that an accident has befallen some of their precious research... 

Perhaps when I next return, I can restock their archives with reports on a multitude of strange creatures. I will show them all a world has to offer.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_8: I miss the dirt, friend, the worlds on which I once walked... I miss the sounds of birds and beasts. Even my data, even my recordings are gone, as if they had never been...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_9:
Nada and Polo appear to be proof that their species are not bound by pre-ordained roles, rebelling against the mantras of greed and conformity.

Polo wishes to know if there are other lifeforms who might join them in this place. They wish for me to interact with a wider sample of Gek, Vy'keen, and Korvax, hoping that I might bring them new friends.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_9: Are there others like us, Traveller? Others who see the truth? I would so like new friends, friend!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_10:
Polo claims that they cannot teach me language directly, that their files on alien languages have been damaged.

I wonder if I am being manipulated somehow. The Gek watches me with an earnest and friendly sorrow, awaiting my discovery of more words. It is almost as if they want to tell me something...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_10:
You are not like me, friend! You can still go to planets. You can still meet new lifeforms, speak, shout, love! Nada and Polo would be killed for going so far!

You must learn more words. You must know how to make yourself heard, Traveller! You are our only friend.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_11:
Polo proclaims that the best way to live is to stop doing what anyone tells me and go enjoy myself.

See the stars, earn a fortune, buy myself something nice. That's what they would do in my shoes, claims the Gek, nudging me in the ribs.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_11: Sometimes I miss currency, Traveller. I know that I should not, I know that adventure is its own reward, but I used to be able to buy such nice things...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_12:
Polo seems to wish to encourage my development as a spacefarer, but repeatedly alludes to some deeper purpose, some hidden truth to all of this.

Polo suggests that I should once again throw myself into combat with pirates. What a thrilling existence that would be, they argue, miming dogfighting craft with their hands while making sound effects.

When I remind Polo of their earlier sadness and fear of violence, the Gek laughs, clearly troubled. Destroy ships or do not destroy ships... they understand it now. It will change nothing.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_13:
I notice a strange-looking message on one of Polo's panels. As the Gek spots my gaze, their brow furrows. Whatever the news is, it isn't good. Polo hurriedly turns off the screen when they see me, forcing a smile onto an anxious face.

Trying to be friendly, the Gek states that the Sentinels have started to detect the presence of their anomaly in various systems. 

If the Sentinels are not distracted soon, they might kill Nada and Polo before their proper time. But Polo assures me not to worry. As long as we have friends, nothing will ever truly be wrong.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_13: They have found us! Eheu, Nada! Eheu!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_14:
Polo and I treat each other as friends, trusted companions in our ongoing adventure among the stars. I know the Gek has a secret, but I trust that it will be shared with me in time.

For now, Polo encourages me to become the ultimate explorer, to push myself to the limits. There are places out there where none have survived. But perhaps I can succeed where others have failed...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_15:
My friend tells me that they are going to die. That the time of Nada and Polo is coming to an end. They cannot say more. They cannot explain it. But they must say goodbye to all they have known.

Grief-stricken, I try to offer condolences, but Polo gathers their composure. They tell me to warp further than ever before, to visit places that no-one will ever see again. They tell me to be what I am: a Traveller.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_LANG_15: I have something to tell you, friend. Something I should have told you long ago...
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_DESC_16:
Whatever is making them ill, the Gek's sense of wonder remains. They are keen to witness the majesty of the stars through my eyes. 

Creatures are existence at its strangest, its wildest. I will show Polo all I can before their death. I will be their friend.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_REQUEST_DESC_:
Polo is busy analysing my most recent reports, lost in a world of data, and needs no assistance just yet.

They are keen that I continue my exploration, however, and offer a range of technologies to further this cause.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_REQUEST_LANG_: Always more to do, oh yes, but not just now, friend. Go, be free, see the stars!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_REQUEST_RES_A: Clever! A strong suit, a long life, friend!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_REQUEST_RES_B: Fight only to survive, friend. Treasure the galaxy and all its wonder!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_REQ_LOOP_DESC:
Polo stares out into the darkness of the anomaly. They try to make peace with their life's end.

They are keen that I continue my exploration, however, and offer a range of technologies to further this cause.
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_REQ_LOOP_LANG: Always more to do, oh yes, but not just now, friend. Go, be free, see the stars!
data.TRA_NPC_U3ANOMALY_REQ_LOOP_RES_: Go further, go faster, see it all! Have no regrets, friend! I am proud of you!
data.UI_ATLAS_MISSION_DESC: I found an Atlas Interface onboard a crimson station. It spoke to me in a voice unlike any I have ever heard. It asks for 'seeds'. I feel compelled to obey.
data.UI_ATLAS_MISSION_OBJ_TIP: Look for interfaces on the galaxy map. Nada and Polo may be able to assist.
data.UI_NADAPOLO_MISSION_DESC: There is a strange space station in this system, an anomaly outside of the day-to-day business of the Gek, Vy'keen and Korvax. It emits a strange signal, as if it is speaking directly and exclusively to me...
data.UI_NADAPOLO_MISSION_LOOP_DESC:
Nada and Polo's journey through time and space continues, at a pace only they understand. They remain in touch, and will happily come to visit any location I bring to their attention.

Use the <TECHNOLOGY>Starship Scanner<> to send a signal to the Space Anomaly.
data.UI_NADAPOLO_MISSION_OBJ1_TIP_A: Board the mysterious station and speak to those aboard...
data.UI_NADAPOLO_MISSION_OBJ1_TIP: Speak to Nada and Polo onboard the station
