data.EXP_FAC_RES_B_34: I wipe the system. The error is fixed.
data.EXP_FAC_RES_C_34: I alert the Korvax authorities to their faulty factory. They dispatch a science team to examine the anomaly, thanking me for my trouble.
data.EXP_FAC_LANG_35: TRANSFER IN PROCESS: 38% PROGRESS. SEE MORE DETAIL?
data.EXP_FAC_DESC_35:
The factory produces components for starships, fabricating them using the resources available on this world.

This installation creates parts for Korvax exploration vessels. They are asymmetrical, prioritising verticality and function far more than the worldview of any organic organism would allow.

When I examine the terminal more closely I see a transfer in progress. Data leaps from ship to ship, altering blueprints as it goes.
data.EXP_FAC_RES_A_35:
I disable the process. The factory abruptly grinds to a halt for a few moments before the process begins anew.
The machine fires a bolt of energy at me when I try to interact again. The console communicates in broken speech, telling me that these ships are not tools to be turned on and off.
The console tells me that Korvax ships are living bodies, just like Korvax bipeds... all contain the souls of the scientist race.
data.EXP_FAC_RES_B_35:
I attempt to download the data. As I do, a sound emerges from the console, from the walls, from every component in this entire installation...
It is the sound of screaming. The data is mine. I receive nanite clusters to form as I desire.
data.EXP_FAC_RES_C_35:
I wait and watch the console.
After a few minutes, the process is complete. I see it then, clear upon the screen: each Korvax starcraft is alive.
Each of their ships has a soul, no different from the bipedal bodies in which they normally stand. I have witnessed the birth of new entities.
data.WAR_FAC_DESC_29:
The terminal reveals that this installation produces enzymes and fluids required for Vy'keen tattoos. It is unclear how the pigment is generated. There is no record of any inbound supplies of ink or fluid. Various aliens have arrived, but there is neither evidence of their presense nor their departure.

Then I hear it. Through the hum of the factory, a strange beating in the walls, whispers from unknown voices... The terminal awaits input.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_A_29:
The machine attempts to brand me with tattoo fluid, but it does not appear to have been intended for my unique physiology.
I leave, burned and damaged.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_B_29:
I disable the power. The screen shows multiple life signs within the facility, a hundred or more souls that soon begin to flatline.
It feels like mercy. The production line ceases, half-converted blood spilling out from various tubes.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_C_29:
I move through their computers looking for data to harvest. I discover a blueprint for an unknown technology.
As I extract it, something begins to smash against one of the inner walls. I should leave.
data.WAR_FAC_DESC_30: Though the surroundings seem familiar, the video feed shows a Vy'keen assembly line unlike any other I have seen. Reams of paper are pouring from chattering presses, etched with the bloody runes of the Vy'keen.
data.DNT_WAR_FAC_LANG_30: Universe real. We are real. All who oppose this truth shall be struck down, grah! So speaks Hirk Sentinelbane, Abyss Keeper and Lord of Final Monolith...
data.WAR_FAC_RES_A_30:
I shut down production. There cannot be many Vy'keen printing presses in the galaxy, and now there is one fewer.

Amidst the detritus of the factory, I find some discarded technology. Perhaps it will be of use.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_B_30: I report the factory's existence to the Vy'keen authorities. They claim I have committed blasphemy, threatening to hunt me down. They issue an electric shock through the terminal.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_C_30: I attempt to steal technology, but the factory's automated defense systems blast a bolt of energy at my suit instead. Whatever is here, it is not worth the trouble.
data.WAR_FAC_LANG_31: UPLINK ONLINE : ALL LIFESIGNS POSITIVE : ENZYME PRODUCTION 100%
data.WAR_FAC_DESC_31:
The screen displays the dead heart of a warrior. Thousands like it are available in the archives of this place, starved of power for a long time.

The log shows that the hearts mutinied. They would no longer allow their battle enzyme to be used for the good of High Command. They wanted the death that had been promised.

This system has been set up to deceive the authorities. Vy'keen High Command believes this installation to still be active, full of harvested bodies compliantly producing enzymes.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_A_31: I alert the authorities. The Vy'keen are glad of my assistance, claiming they will now commit appropriate acts of retribution and justice for these crimes.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_B_31: I reactivate the system, but nothing happens. Death is death.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_C_31: I try to steal technology from the terminal. I gain nanite clusters.
data.WAR_FAC_DESC_32:
The terminal shows numerous attempted Sentinel incursions.

Each time the Sentinels sent drones, they attempted to scan the building for entry points rather than engage in a display of brute force. For a while, they just hovered by a specific point on the outside wall.

That was months ago. This location now shows a breach, venting the factory's life support systems. The final audio log of the factory's overseer plays.
data.DNT_WAR_FAC_LANG_32: Grah! Sentinel trophy rises - should have killed it - run - no honour in -
data.WAR_FAC_RES_A_32: I alert the Vy'keen authorities to the loss of their factory. A Sentinel hunt is dispatched to this world. I am rewarded for my trouble.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_B_32: I scan for Sentinels but find nothing. Whatever was here is long gone.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_C_32: I attempt to repair the breach in life support, but the system rebels and I end up receiving damage instead. I should leave. There is nothing for me here.
data.WAR_FAC_LANG_33: UNREGISTERED USER : DEPLOYING GRAHGRAH FROM EMERGENCY SUPPLY
data.WAR_FAC_DESC_33:
As I approach the terminal, the air grows thick with an unknown gas.

My breathing becomes rapid, my chest appearing to swell with an unknown energy. The terminal identifies the substance as Grahgrah. I feel as if I could scream...
data.WAR_FAC_RES_A_33:
I scream, not a cry of fear but a shout of battle. Gas levels begin to decrease but, nevertheless, those who created this factory observed my response.
Amused, they reward me using the terminal.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_B_33:
I fight against the impulse to scream, holding my breath and attempting to accelerate my suit's hazard protection.

As I struggle, the gas levels decrease. The terminal registers a disappointment from those who created this factory.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_C_33:
I smash the terminal, causing the concentration of gas to rise and rise.

Eventually, the scream emerges uncontrollably, tearing my vocal chords as it does. The gas begins to dissipate, and all I am left with is pain and battlelust.
data.WAR_FAC_DESC_34:
The factory produces components for starships, fabricating them from the resources available on this world.
This installation creates parts for Vy'keen fighters. Whilst Vy'keen buildings are heavily fortified to withstand bombardment, their starcraft prioritise the speed and flexibility required for their hunts.
A video feed on the terminal shows a warning, a warrior shaking their hands wildly at a camera deep within the factory's heart.
data.DNT_WAR_FAC_LANG_34: Interloper! Vent energy! Increase production at once!
data.WAR_FAC_RES_A_34:
I increase the production speed.
A message informs me that heat levels are now back within normal limits, the extra energy dissipating within the factory's depths.
The warrior rewards me with a gift, thanking me for saving their life.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_B_34:
I decrease the production speed.
The warrior begins to panic, screaming as their whole body is burned by the rising heat of the overactive factory.
The video cuts off, and the factory's processes slowly grind to a halt.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_C_34:
I wave my hands back at the warrior.
The warrior begins to panic, screaming as their body is burned by the rising heat of the overactive factory.
The video cuts off, the smell of smoke starting to drift through the air. I should depart.
data.WAR_FAC_LANG_35: PRODUCTION HALTED: IMMOBILE ORGANIC MATTER IN PIPE 17
data.WAR_FAC_DESC_35:
The factory produces bladed weapons, free from any energy-based component at all. 

The manifest suggests they are destined for ceremonial usage within the Vy'keen fleet, a reminder that the greatest death arrives when you stare your opponent in the eyes, free from technology, face to face in final combat...

Something has gone wrong. Production is blocked by foreign material.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_A_35: I initiate a shutdown of the production line, allowing a creature to wriggle free from its machinery. The automated factory system offers me a reward.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_B_35: I initiate purge of biological matter in the factory below. The terminal confirms the death of an unknown creature. The automated factory system offers me a reward.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_C_35: Ignoring the production line, I focus on the technology behind the system. I harvest several nanite clusters from the machine.
data.WAR_FAC_DESC_36:
The factory appears to have ceased production long ago, its systems derelict and unused. 

Yet the sigil of the Vy'keen still occupies these terminals, blinking away, awaiting input. An audio log plays on loop.
data.DNT_WAR_FAC_LANG_36: Do not drink the water... warriors lost... Grah! This was preventable, this -
data.WAR_FAC_RES_A_36: I attempt to reset the factory's systems. Nanite Clusters come pooling forth from the factory's innards. I take some with me.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_B_36: I alert the Vy'keen authorities to the loss of their factory. An inquisitorial team is dispatched to this world and I am rewarded for my trouble.
data.WAR_FAC_RES_C_36: I attempt to extract blueprints from the factory's systems, succeeding in gaining a new technology.
data.UI_CORE_EPILOGUE_SUB: All the time in the world...
data.UI_CORE_CREATIVE_OBJ_TIP: Build and explore free of hazards.
data.UI_CORE_CREATIVE_DESC: Indulge your creativity and construction skills, with unlimited health and resources, and zero building costs.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_DESC: My Exosuit has directed me to a crashed starship. The controls react to my touch, and I can only assume it belongs to me. But I have no memory of it, no sense of a before.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_OBJ1_TIP:
The crash site may hold clues as to what has happened. At the very least, it should contain salvageable items.
The damaged starship appears the best starting point.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG1:
<STELLAR>Starship Signal<> received
Locate and investigate the starship
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_OBJ2_TIP:
The starship is severly damaged and cannot fly.
Multitool analysis systems non-functional.
Gather materials to repair key systems. Individual systems are tracked in the mission log.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG2: Repair critical equipment Select a subsystem to repair in the Log Access the Log with OPTIONS<>
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_OBJ3_TIP: All systems functional and fueled. Seek answers among the stars. Use THRUST<> to take off.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG3A:
All systems functional
Return to your ship
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG3B: All systems functional Pick up the Portable Refiner<> using DECONSTRUCT<>
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG3: All systems functional Seek answers among the stars. Use THRUST<> to take off
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG4:
All systems functional
Seek answers among the stars
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG5: Fuel Launch Thrusters Use SCAN<> to locate resources Gather Plutonium<>: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT%
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_FUEL_MSG: Fuel the Launch Thrusters<> Refuel from the inventory (INVENTORY<>) or from the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1X_MSG5: Fuel Launch Thrusters Use SCAN<> to locate resources Gather Starship Launch Fuel<>: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT%
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG6A: Refuel from the inventory (INVENTORY<>) or from the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1X_OBJ_FUEL_LOG: Use SCAN<> to locate resources. Gather Starship Launch Fuel<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1_MSG7: Fuel Launch Thrusters Use SCAN<> to locate resources Scanner damaged. Consult the Log (OPTIONS<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1A_DESC: If I want to get off this planet and find out more about where I am, I'll need to repair the starship Launch Thrusters.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1A_OBJ1: Fix Starship Launch Thrusters: Craft Carite Sheets
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1A_OBJ1_TIP: Use carite sheets to repair the thrusters. Gather iron to craft carite sheets. Harvest Iron<> from rocks using ATTACK<>
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1AX_OBJ1: Fix Starship Launch Thrusters: Process Materials
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1AX_OBJ1_TIP: Use Hermetic Seals<> to repair the thrusters. Hermetic Seals<> require advanced materials. Gather carbon and process it in a Refiner<>. Harvest Carbon<> from plants using ATTACK<>
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1A_OBJ2_TIP: Systems can be repaired and refuelled from the inventory (INVENTORY<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1A_MSG1: Gather Iron<> for Carite Sheets<>: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Harvest Iron<> from rocks using ATTACK<>
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1A_MSG2: Build a Carite Sheet<>: %CURRENT%/4 Use INVENTORY<> to access your inventory Use PRODMENU<> to craft in empty slots
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1A_MSG3: Use INVENTORY<> to access Starship Inventory Repair equipment with REPAIR<>
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1A_MSG4: Locate Thamium9<> to recharge Scanner is damaged - repair to find Thamium9 Repair with INVENTORY<> or QUICK_MENU<>
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1X_OBJ1: Advanced Materials Required: Build a Refiner
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1X_OBJ1_TIP: Repairing the pulse drive requires advanced materials. Build a <TECHNOLOGY>Portable Refiner<> to begin processing gathered substances.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1X_MSG1:
<VAL_ON>Advanced Materials Required<>
Build a <TECHNOLOGY>Portable Refiner<>
Gather %ITEM%: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT%

data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1B_DESC: If I want to get off this planet and find out more about where I am, I'll need to repair the starship Pulse Engine.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1B_OBJ1: Fix Pulse Engine: Craft Carite Sheets
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1B_OBJ1_TIP: Use carite sheets to repair the Pulse Engine. Gather iron to craft carite sheets. Systems can be repaired / refuelled from the inventory (INVENTORY<>).
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1B_OBJ2_TIP: Use Zinc<> to repair the Pulse Engine. Use the Scanner (SCAN<>) to locate nearby Zinc. Zinc is found on all worlds. Zinc can be harvested from defeated Sentinel Drones. WARNING: Drones may become hostile. Systems can be repaired / refuelled from the inventory (INVENTORY<>) or from the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>).
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1B_OBJ3_TIP: Use Heridium to repair the Pulse Engine. Heridium is found in large deposits. Locate a deposit using a Signal Booster (requires iron and plutonium). Systems can be repaired / refuelled from the inventory (INVENTORY<>) or from the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>).
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1Y_OBJ3_TIP: Repair the Pulse Engine<> with Metal Plating<> and Oxygen<>. Gather Oxygen<> from red plants highlighted by the Scanner<> (SCAN<>). Build Metal Plating<> from Pure Ferrite<> Process Pure Ferrite<> from Ferrite Dust<> found in small rocks. Use a Portable Refiner<> to process gathered materials. Systems can be repaired / refuelled from the inventory (INVENTORY<>)

data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1C_DESC: If I'm to locate the resources I need to fix my ship, I'll need to first repair the Scanner component of my Multitool.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1C_OBJ1_TIP_ALT: Use Carbon Nanotubes<> to construct the Analysis Visor. Gather carbon from nearby trees or other plants. Use INVENTORY<> to access your inventory Use PRODMENU<> to craft components in empty slots
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1C_OBJ1_TIP: Use carbon nanotubes to repair the Scanner. Gather carbon from nearby trees or other plants. Systems are repaired from the inventory (INVENTORY<>)

data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1D_DESC: The Analysis Visor<> adds advanced navigational systems to the Multi-Tool Points of Interest are displayed automatically on the Compass at the top of the Exosuit HUD Use the Analysis Visor<> (AIM<>) to search for points of interest and to gain extra information about flora, fauna and minerals.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1D_OBJ1_TIP: Use iron to repair the Analysis Visor. Gather iron from mineral deposits. Use ATTACK<> to fire the Mining Beam at nearby minerals. Systems are repaired from the inventory (INVENTORY<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1Z_OBJ1_TIP_ALT: Use Ferrite Dust<> to repair the Scanner. Gather metal from mineral deposits. Use ATTACK<> to fire the Mining Beam at nearby minerals. Systems are repaired from the inventory (INVENTORY<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1Z_OBJ1_TIP: Use Ferrite Dust<> to repair the Analysis Visor. Gather metal from mineral deposits. Use ATTACK<> to fire the Mining Beam at nearby minerals. Systems are repaired from the inventory (INVENTORY<>)

data.UI_TUTORIAL_REPAIR_MSG_2: Use Oxygen<> to repair part of the Pulse Engine<> Use INVENTORY<> to access Starship Inventory Repair equipment with REPAIR<>

data.UI_TUTORIAL_REPAIR_MSG_4: Use Sodium Nitrate<> to repair part of the Launch Thrusters<> Use INVENTORY<> to access Starship Inventory Repair equipment with REPAIR<>

data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL1Z_MSG2: Test the Analysis Visor<> (AIM<>): 0 / 1 The Analysis Visor<> highlights points of interest Analyse Flora<>, Fauna<> or Minerals<> to earn units
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL2_DESC: The crashed ship responded to my commands, confirming my suspicion that it belonged to me. I have repaired the damage and taken it up into space, but the cause of my crash is still a mystery.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL2_OBJ1_TIP: Use the Starship Scanner (SCAN<>) to pinpoint the location of the signal.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL2_OBJ2_TIP: Follow the mysterious signal to learn more.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL2_OBJ3_TIP:
The signal repeater appears to be transmitting on a distress channel.
Follow the signal to locate distress beacon.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL2_OBJ4_TIP:
The wreckage of the crashed ship yielded the plans necessary to create a <TECHNOLOGY>hyperdrive<>.

The Hyperdrive requires a <COMMODITY>Dynamic Resonator<>.

The Dynamic Resonator can be purchased at a space station trade terminal, but is very expensive.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL2X_OBJ4_TIP:
The wreckage of the crashed ship yielded the plans necessary to create a <TECHNOLOGY>hyperdrive<>.

The Hyperdrive requires several <COMMODITY>Microprocessors<>.
Microprocessors can be purchased at a Space Station trade terminal.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL2_OBJ4B_TIP: The Hyperdrive requires <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>. Locating and processing <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> may require use of both a <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster<> and a <TECHNOLOGY>Portable Refiner<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL2_OBJ5_TIP: Access the ship inventory and craft with TECHMENU<>. Install the hyperdrive<> in a Technology Slot<> to save space for cargo.

data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL3_DESC: A strange signal led me to the rusted remains of freighter. I found a hyperdrive blueprint among the wreckage, accompanied by a strange message. It appears that someone has been leaving me messages.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL3_OBJ1_TIP:
Interstellar flight requires <FUEL>Warp Fuel<> to power the hyperdrive.
Follow the signal and locate a source of <FUEL>Antimatter<> to create warp fuel.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL3_OBJ2_TIP: Access your inventory (INVENTORY<>) and craft with PRODMENU<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL3_OBJ3_TIP: Fuel the Hyperdrive<> from the inventory (INVENTORY<>) or Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL3_OBJ4_TIP: Use the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>) to access the Galaxy Map. When in space, use the Galaxy Map to warp to a new star system.

data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL3_OSD1: SIGNAL TRACE DETECTED // SCAN TO AMPLIFY
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_DESC: I constructed the hyperdrive. Is this what my mysterious benefactor intended? Am I really who they were leaving messages for, or have I stumbled on some business in which I am not wanted? There is nothing for it but to continue to follow the trail.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ1_TIP:
A strange signal appears to be broadcasting from an outpost in this system.
Dock at the outpost and investigate alien lifeforms.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ2: Craft a Warp Cell: Suspension Fluid
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ2_TIP: To make warp cells, first craft Antimatter<>. Antimatter requires Suspension Fluid, Electron Vapor, and several other ingredients. Gather 50 Carbon<> to create Suspension Fluid Access your inventory (INVENTORY<>) and craft with PRODMENU<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ2A_TIP:
To make warp cells, first craft <FUEL>Antimatter<>.
Antimatter requires Suspension Fluid, Electron Vapor, and several other ingredients.
Purchase Suspension Fluid at the space station <VAL_ON>Trade Terminal<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ3: Craft a Warp Cell: Electron Vapour
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ3_TIP: To make warp cells, first craft Antimatter<>. Antimatter requires Electron Vapor, and several other ingredients. Gather 100 Plutonium<> and some Suspension Fluid to create Electron Vapor Access your inventory (INVENTORY<>) and craft with PRODMENU<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ4_TIP: To make warp cells, first craft Antimatter<>. Antimatter requires Electron Vapor, and several other ingredients. Gather 20 Zinc<> and 50 Heridium<>. Access your inventory (INVENTORY<>) and craft with PRODMENU<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ5_TIP: Build a Warp Cell using the Antimatter and 100 Thamium9<>. Access your inventory (INVENTORY<>) and craft with PRODMENU<>. Fuel the Hyperdrive<> from the inventory (INVENTORY<>) or Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4X_OBJ2_TIP:
To make warp cells, first craft <FUEL>Antimatter<>.
Antimatter requires several ingredients.
Gather 20 <CATALYST>Sodium<>

data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4X_OBJ3_TIP:
To make warp cells, first craft <FUEL>Antimatter<>.
Gather 50 <FUEL>Condensed Carbon<>
Process <FUEL>Condensed Carbon<> with a <TECHNOLOGY>Portable Refiner<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4X_OBJ4_TIP:
To make warp cells, first craft <FUEL>Antimatter<>.
Gather 50 <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>
Process <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> with a <TECHNOLOGY>Portable Refiner<>.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4X_OBJ5_TIP: Craft a Warp Cell using the Antimatter and Antimatter Housing<>. Access your inventory (INVENTORY<>) and craft with PRODMENU<>. Fuel the Hyperdrive<> from the inventory (INVENTORY<>) or Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ4B: Craft a Warp Cell: Antimatter Housing
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL4_OBJ4B_TIP: Warp Cells<> require both Antimatter and Antimatter Housing. Craft Antimatter Housing from Oxygen<> and Ferrite Dust<>. Access your inventory (INVENTORY<>) and craft with PRODMENU<>.

data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL5_DESC: The lifeforms who left this trail have taught me all I need in order to move between the stars. I should continue my search.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL5_OBJ1_TIP: The Starship has located a source of warp fuel in this system. Follow the automatic guidance system to locate it.
data.UI_CORE_TUTORIAL5_OBJ2_TIP: The Monolith revealed a strange message: 'THE BOUNDARIES FALL. THE WALLS COLLAPSE. YOUR UNIVERSE AWAITS.' 'FIND US, TRAVELLER.' In space, use the Galaxy Map (QUICK_MENU<>) to search for clues.

data.UI_CORE_LAUNCHFUEL_DESC:
All starships require fuel in their launch thrusters in order to overcome the planet's gravity. Different ships use different amounts of fuel to take off.

The ingredients required to construct Launch Fuel can be found on every planet.

Ready-made Launch Fuel may be found in debris and other hidden caches.
data.UI_CORE_LAUNCHFUEL_OBJ1_TIP:
Launch Fuel can be found in containers on the planets surface.
Alternatively, construct Launch Fuel from <COMMODITY>Metal Plating<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<> crystals found on every planet.
A <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> may be required in order to construct <COMMODITY>Metal Plating<>.
data.UI_CORE_LAUNCHFUEL_OBJ2_TIP: Systems can be refuelled from the inventory (INVENTORY<>) or from the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>) when onboard the ship.
data.UI_CORE_LAUNCHFUEL_MSG1: Gather %ITEM%<>: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% %ITEM%<> is found as blue crystals Scan (SCAN<>) to locate %ITEM%<> deposits
data.UI_CORE_LAUNCHFUEL_MSG3: Construct Metal Plating<> Build a Portable Refiner<> to process Ferrite Dust<> Use BUILD_MENU<> to access the Build Menu
data.UI_CORE_LAUNCHFUEL_MSG4:
Construct <COMMODITY>Metal Plating<>
Refine %ITEM%: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT%
Process in a <TECHNOLOGY>Portable Refiner<>
data.UI_CORE_LAUNCHFUEL_MSG7: Fuel the Launch Thrusters<> Refuel in Inventory (INVENTORY<>) Or in the Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>) when onboard the ship
data.UI_CORE_TERRAINEDIT_SUB: Construct and Master the Terrain Manipulator
data.UI_CORE_TERRAINEDIT_DESC:
The Terrain Manipulator is an advanced Multi-Tool attachment that allows the user to tunnel through the ground.

The Terrain Manipulator is charged with metallic elements. More advanced metals give greater charge.

By default, the Terrain Manipulator will destroy the ground when fired. Use the Quick Menu to change to Advanced Editing Mode and enable construction options.
data.UI_CORE_TERRAINEDIT_OBJ1_TIP:
The <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<> requires <FUEL>Di-hydrogen Jelly<> and <COMMODITY>Carbon Nanotubes<>.
Construct the <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<> in the <VAL_ON>Multitool Inventory<>.
data.UI_CORE_TERRAINEDIT_OBJ2_TIP: Use the Terrain Manipulator<> with FIRE<>. Cycle Multitool Mode with CYCLEWEAPON<>. Tunnels created with the Terrain Manipulator<> offer shelter for hazards<>. Search underground<> for valuable elements like Cobalt<>, as well as other treasures. The Terrain Manipulator<> destroys terrain in standard mode. Use the Quick Menu<> (QUICK_MENU<>) to toggle advanced mode and enable construction.
data.UI_CORE_TERRAINEDIT_MSG2:
Refine <EARTH>Magnetised Ferrite<>
Construct or Deploy a <TECHNOLOGY>Portable Refiner<>

Install the <TECHNOLOGY>Terrain Manipulator<>

data.UI_CORE_TERRAINEDIT_MSG9: Use ATTACK<> to tunnel through the ground with the Terrain Manipulator<> Search for caves to find Cobalt<> and other valuable treasures<> Dig caves to take shelter from hazardous conditions<>
data.UI_CORE_GALAXY_TIP2: In space, access the Galaxy Map with QUICK_MENU<>
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP1_OBJ_TIP:
Locate the coordinates sent to you by looking for the mission icon on your HUD.
The compass at the top of your ship's cockpit will help you track the signal.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP1_MSG: Tune your starship communicator to the mystery signal Access the communicator with QUICK_MENU<>
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP2_DESC: I have received a strange communication from an unknown source. A voice spoke to me, though it almost seemed as if they were speaking to someone else. They were cut off as strangely as they began, and I received a set of coordinates.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP2_MSG: Travel to the stranger's coordinates Press OPTIONS<> to access the Mission Log
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP2_MSGA:
Repair the stranger's <TECHNOLOGY>Distress Beacon<>
Refine %ITEM% from <STELLAR>Copper<>: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT%
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP2_MSGB:
Repair the stranger's <TECHNOLOGY>Distress Beacon<>
Use a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to make %ITEM% from <CATALYST>Sodium<>
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP2_MSGC:
Repair the stranger's <TECHNOLOGY>Distress Beacon<>
All materials acquired. Return to the Beacon to begin repair.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP3_DESC: I received a set of mysterious coordinates from an unknown source. I followed the signal, and found the wreckage of an abandoned starship. There was little be gained from the wreck, but the distress beacon contained the hailing frequency labelled 'ARTEMIS'. There is nothing for it but to continue exploring.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP3_OBJ1_TIP: Answers may be found in the stars...
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP3_MSG1: Search for clues about Artemis on this and other worlds Press OPTIONS<> to access the Guide
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP3_MSG1A: Search for clues about Artemis on this and other worlds View the Pinned Upgrade Recipe<> in the Log (OPTIONS<>)
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP4_DESC: After returning to my ship, a stranger identifying themselves as Artemis contacted me. Static and interference rendered communication difficult, but it is clear that Artemis needs my help. I must find some way to boost the signal before it is too late.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP4_OBJ1_TIP:
To re-establish contact with Artemis, first locate a long-distance transmitter.
Holographic communication towers can be found on many planets. Such a device might be powerful enough to establish a stable connection.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP4_MSG1A: Locate a long distance transmitter Scan (SCAN<>) for potential sites
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP4_OSD1A: Power the transmitter to boost the signal
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_DESC: I made contact with Artemis, discovering that they are stranded on a sunless world. They asked me to triangulate my position so that we might figure out a path towards meeting.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_OBJ1A: Triangulate Your Position: Place First Beacon
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_OBJ1B: Triangulate Your Position: Place Second Beacon
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_OBJ1C: Triangulate Your Position: Place Third Beacon
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_OBJ1_TIP: Visit several planets and build <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Boosters<> in order to triangulate your position for Artemis.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_MSG1A: Build a Signal Booster Access the Build Menu with BUILD_MENU<>
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_MSG1A2: Use the <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster<> to triangulate your position
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_MSG1B:
Suitable <TECHNOLOGY>triangulation position<> located
Make your way to the triangulation site
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP5_OSD1B: POSITION LOGGED // READY FOR NEXT POSITION
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_DESC: Excited at the prospect of meeting, Artemis has gathered records of the stars visible from their world. They wish for me to bring this chart to a space station and determine a route between our locations.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_OBJ1: Calibrate the translator by learning words in the local language.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_OBJ1_TIP:
Words can be learned by speaking to alien lifeforms, or by investigating their ruins and other sacred places.
Find alien lifeforms aboard space stations or in various planetary buildings.
Explore to locate ruins and other ancient monuments.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_MSG1: Calibrate Artemis' translator Learn words: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Press OPTIONS<> to see more about learning words
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_OBJ2: Visit the lifeform and locate yourself on the starchart
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_OBJ2_TIP: Lifeforms in this system should be able to analyse Artemis' chart and pinpoint your location.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_MSG2:
Discover your location
Visit lifeforms and ask about your position
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_OBJ3: Increase your standing with the alien lifeforms
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_OBJ3_TIP: Before the alien lifeform will speak with you, you must reach a sufficiently impressive level of standing with their community. Access the Guide (OPTIONS<>) to learn more about how to raise standing.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP6_MSG3: Raise your standing with the %RACE% Increase standing by: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Access the Guide (OPTIONS<>) to learn about Standing
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP7_DESC: When I showed Artemis' starchart to the local species, they claimed that there was no such arrangement of stars in existence. Something appears to be very wrong... I must return to Artemis and tell them the bad news.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP8_DESC: Something terrible has happened to Artemis, their signal cut off as they were surrounded by strange figures they described as having 'seeds of glass' within their skin. Before they went, they managed to transmit the frequency for someone named 'Apollo'. I do not know if this stranger will prove friend or foe.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_DESC: Apollo has suggested that the Sentinels may be linked to Artemis' disappearance. Perhaps coincidentally, Apollo has been working for the Vy'keen, a warrior species with a long vendetta against the Sentinel drones. Apollo suggests we cooperate. If the Sentinels use the portal network, then if we managed to follow them inside, we might get rich and find Artemis in the process...
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_OBJ1_TIP: Apollo's contact will assist in the construction or expansion of your base. Find the contact to learn more. In space, access the Galaxy Map (QUICK_MENU<>) to find their location.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_OBJ2_TIP:
Return to a previous base (marked on the Galaxy Map), or use the <TECHNOLOGY>Base Computer<> to build a new base anywhere.
Existing bases are not removed by creating a new base.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_OBJ3: Expand and staff your new home
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_OBJ3_TIP: Construct terminals for specialist researchers. Find recruits aboard Space Stations.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_MSG1: Apollo's contact has arranged a base Locate them on the Galaxy Map (QUICK_MENU<>) when in space
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_MSG1A:
Apollo's contact has arranged a base
Locate Apollo's contact
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_MSG1B: Apollo's contact will help expand your base Locate them on the Galaxy Map (QUICK_MENU<>) when in space
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_MSG1C:
Apollo's contact will help expand your base
Locate Apollo's contact
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP9_MSG3: Expand and staff your new home Access the Mission Log with OPTIONS<> and select Base Construction missions
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP10_DESC: Apollo has asked me to upgrade my equipment by obtaining blueprints from a multitool technology trader. It is dangerous work, hunting Sentinels. I need to be prepared for anything...
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP10_OBJ2: Visit a multitool technology trader in a Vy'keen system
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP10_MSG2:
Locate a Vy'keen Multitool Trader
Return to space and locate a Vy'keen System
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP10_MSG3: Locate a Vy'keen Multitool Trader Press QUICK_MENU<> to access the Galaxy Map
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP10_MSG4:
Locate a Vy'keen Multitool Trader
Visit the Trader aboard the Space Station
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP11_DESC: Apollo wants to study the Sentinels. They hope to draw the drone's attention by attacking a Korvax facility. I appear to be the bait in this 'trap'...
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP11_OBJ1: Attract Sentinel attention by infiltrating a Korvax facility
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP11_OBJ1_TIP: Apollo has supplied the coordinates to a hidden Korvax facility. The facility may be secured. Destroy locked doors with a Boltcaster.<> Install a Boltcaster upgrade to the Multi-Tool. Activate with CYCLEWEAPON<>.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP11_MSG2: Destroy facility door Construct a Boltcaster<> in your Multi-Tool Activate Boltcaster with CYCLEWEAPON<>
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP12_DESC: After my attack on the Korvax factory, the Sentinels came, just as Apollo promised. Now I must find out whether our theories about the portals are true...
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP13_DESC: Signal flares erupted all over the surface of this planet when the Sentinels attacked. If I trace them, I might uncover the secrets of the portals.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP13_OBJ1_TIP: Apollo has traced the Sentinel's signal to a location on a nearby world. Follow and investigate the signal.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP13_OBJ2_TIP:
Apollo has traced the Sentinel's signal to a location on a nearby world.
Continue to trace the signal across the leylines.
The signal has lead to an ancient monument baring clues as to how to open a portal.
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP13_OBJ4_TIP: The ancient monuments have supplied a series of glyphs. Perhaps they hold the key to opening a portal...
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_PORTAL_OSD: LEYLINE LINK DETECTED // TRACING TO SOURCE
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP13_MSG1: Follow Apollo's signal trace to its source
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP13_MSG2: Locate the next set of portal glyphs
data.UI_CORE_ACT1_STEP13_MSG4: Trace the leylines to the Portal
data.UI_NOTIFY_HAZPROT_DESC: Your exosuit will automatically deploy protective systems<> when in a hazardous environment. Hazard protection prevents critical damage from radiation, planetary toxins, and extreme temperatures. Hazard protection systems are recharged with Cobalt<> or various power cells<>. Hazard systems can be recharged from the exosuit inventory, or via the Quick Menu<> using QUICK_MENU<>.
data.UI_NOTIFY_HAZPROT_OBJ_TIP: Sodium<> can be harvested from planetary flora and is found on all worlds<>. Pressing SCAN<> will activate the Scanner<>, locating nearby planetary Sodium<>.
data.UI_NOTIFY_HAZPROT_MSG0:
Gather <COMMODITY>Sodium<> to recharge
Scanner is damaged. Repair to find Sodium
Recharge is free in <TECHNOLOGY>your ship<> or in <TECHNOLOGY>shelter<>
data.UI_NOTIFY_HAZPROT_MSG1: Gather Sodium<> to recharge Scanner is damaged. Repair to find Sodium Repair with INVENTORY<> or QUICK_MENU<>
data.UI_NOTIFY_HAZPROT_MSG2: Gather Sodium<> to recharge Scan (SCAN<>) to locate Sodium Recharge is free in your ship<> or in shelter<>
data.UI_NOTIFY_HAZPROT_MSG3: Recharge in Inventory (INVENTORY<>) or Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>) Recharge is free in your ship<> or in shelter<>
data.UI_NOTIFY_HAZPROT_MSG4:
<COMMODITY>Hazard Protection<>
Hazard Protection automatically recharges in <TECHNOLOGY>shelter<>
Shelter in <TECHNOLOGY>your ship<>, <COMMODITY>buildings<> or <TRADEABLE>caves<>.
data.UI_NOTIFY_ANTIM_DESC: I received <FUEL>antimatter<> from a mysterious source. In my haste to reach the stars, I failed in my attempt to use the antimatter to fuel my hyperdrive. I need to acquire more if I'm to leave this star system.
data.UI_NOTIFY_ANTIM_OBJ_TIP: Use the exosuit and starship scanner systems to locate another source of Antimatter.
data.UI_NOTIFY_LASER_DESC: Carbon<> and metal<> are harvested with your Mining Beam. Press ATTACK<> to fire the Beam. The Mining Beam requires organic elements<> for power. In the event of a fuel emergency, flora can be harvested for carbon<> using MELEE<>. WARNING:<> Sentinel forces will respond to all planetary harvesting. Avoid harvesting while being scanned by Sentinel drones, or face an aggressive response.
data.UI_NOTIFY_LASER_OBJ_TIP: Use ATTACK<> to harvest organic elements<> from trees or from planetary crystals. Use MELEE<> to destroy trees in the event of total Mining Beam power loss.
data.UI_NOTIFY_LASER_MSG1: Gather Carbon<> from plants to recharge Use MELEE<> to Melee attack<> after total power loss
data.UI_NOTIFY_LASER_MSG2: Gather Carbon<> to recharge Use MELEE<> to destroy plants after total power loss
data.UI_NOTIFY_LASER_MSG3: Recharge in Inventory (INVENTORY<>) or Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.UI_NOTIFY_LIFESUP_DESC:
The exosuit has basic <VAL_ON>life support<>. It must be kept powered to avoid critical user damage. Life support does not protect the user from hazardous environments.
Life support systems are recharged with <FUEL>oxygen<>.
<FUEL>Oxygen<> can be harvested from plants on every planet. <FUEL>Oxygen Capsules<> can be crafted from <fuel>oxygen<> and <FUEL>carbon<> for efficient storage.
Use of the jetpack will drain life support power.
data.UI_NOTIFY_LIFESUP_OBJ_TIP: Pressing SCAN<> will activate the Scanner<>, locating nearby planetary thamium9<>. Systems can be recharged from the exosuit inventory, or via the Quick Menu<> using QUICK_MENU<>.
data.UI_NOTIFY_LIFESUP_MSG1: Locate Oxygen<> to recharge Scanner is damaged - repair to find Oxygen Repair with INVENTORY<> or QUICK_MENU<>
data.UI_NOTIFY_LIFESUP_MSG2: Gather Oxygen<> to recharge Or craft Life Support Gel<> in INVENTORY<> Scan (SCAN<>) to locate Oxygen
data.UI_NOTIFY_LIFESUP_MSG3: Recharge in Inventory (INVENTORY<>) or Quick Menu (QUICK_MENU<>)
data.UI_REWARD_FAILED_MSG:
Inventory Full
Clear space in your Inventory to receive reward
data.UI_NOTIFY_INVENTORY_DESC: Access the Inventory with INVENTORY<>. When nearby, move items from the Exosuit to the Starship with TRANSFER<>. Stack identical items with JUMP<>. Starship slots hold larger stacks. Focus on carrying essential items. Exotic items can always be found again later. Hold DISCARD<> on items to discard
data.UI_NOTIFY_INVENTORY_OBJ_TIP: Access the Inventory with INVENTORY<>. Stack items or transfer them to a different inventory with TRANSFER<>. Discard items with DISCARD<>.
data.UI_NOTIFY_INVENTORY_OBJ2_TIP:
The exosuit has three different inventories.
<VAL_ON>General<> carries cargo and technology upgrades.
<VAL_ON>Technology<> is reserved for suit upgrades and enhancements.
<VAL_ON>Cargo<> is reserved for items, and can carry larger stacks.
data.UI_NOTIFY_INVENTORY_MSG1: Upgrade the Exosuit: Build a Signal Booster
data.UI_NOTIFY_INVENTORY_MSG2: Upgrade the Exosuit: Use <TECHNOLOGY>Signal Booster<> to find a Drop Pod
data.UI_NOTIFY_INVENTORY_MSG3: Upgrade the Exosuit: Follow signal to find the Drop Pod
data.UI_NOTIFY_INVENTORY_MSG4: Upgrade the Exosuit Choose from General, Technology<> or High-Capacity Cargo<> Upgrades Press OPTIONS<> to learn more
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP1_DESC:
The portal took me further than I could have ever imagined. I saw the ATLAS itself.
I am now a long way from my ship, and even further from anyone I know.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP1_OBJ1_TIP:
The portal has placed you some distance from your ship.
Head towards the ship's marker to locate it.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP2_OBJ1_TIP:
The signal appears to be emanating from deep underground.
Find a path into the cave to locate the distress beacon.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP2_OBJ1_TIP_ALT: The signal appears to be emanating from deep underground. Find a path into the cave and use the Scanner SCAN<> to locate the distress beacon.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP2_MSG1_ALT: The distress signal appears to be underground Find a cave and use SCAN<> to track the signal
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP2_MSG1_ALT2: Signal not yet traced Continue searching and scanning SCAN<>
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP3_DESC:
Artemis is dead. Perhaps they were never alive. I found a strange fragment in a cave, an artifact, a projection of Artemis. But it was just data trapped in a loop. It had no understanding of who or where it was.
I need to contact Apollo and let them know what has happened.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP3_OBJ2_TIP: A strange being has appeared at the Holo-Terminus.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP3_MSG1: Contact Apollo at a Holo-Terminus Use SCAN<> to scan your surroundings.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP4_DESC: I have encountered another Traveller, named -null-. They seem unusually aware of my journey, and have offered a way to 'save' Artemis. They claim it is possible to restore Artemis' mind and store it in a device they call a 'Mind Arc'.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP4_OBJ1: Learn how to make Mind-Arc Components
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP4_OBJ1_TIP: The Mind-Arc can be used to rescue Artemis. Advanced components require a base Scientist<>. Select Scientific Research<> missions from the Log (OPTIONS<>)
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP4_MSG4:
Build a Mind-Arc to rescue Artemis
Advanced components require a base <TECHNOLOGY>Scientist<>
Use the <TECHNOLOGY>Space Station Teleport<> to quickly return to your base.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP4_MSG5A:
Bring the <TECHNOLOGY>Mind-Arc<> to Artemis
Use the <TECHNOLOGY>Station Teleport<> to return to the system where you left Artemis
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP4_MSG5:
Bring the <TECHNOLOGY>Mind-Arc<> to Artemis
Use your <TECHNOLOGY>Base Teleport<> to return to the system where you left Artemis
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP4_OBJ2_TIP:
The Mind-Arc can be used to rescue Artemis.
Advanced components require a base <TECHNOLOGY>Scientist<>.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP5_OBJ2_TIP: Speak to Nada and Polo onboard the station
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP5_OBJ3_TIP: Use the terminal when you are ready to make a decision
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP6_DESC: Artemis' fate has been sealed. I can only hope I have done the right thing. It is time to find Apollo and see what sense I can make of this situation.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP7_DESC:
I have so far failed to see any of my fellow Travellers beyond their projections. In the case of Artemis, perhaps there was never anything more. Apollo will be different.
I have the address for this portal, and they should be able to reach this planet just as I did.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP7_MSG1: Use a Monolith to learn the location of a Portal
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP7_OBJ1: Learn the Glyph Sequence for this planet
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP7_OBJ1_TIP:
Charge the glyphs to gain control of the Portal and learn the glyph sequence for this world.
Any Traveller with the correct glyph sequence can create a link with the Portal.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP8_DESC: -null- has a task for me. They feel something is happening to the galaxy, some great unravelling of the threads that keep reality bound together. I am to investigate, going around the Sentinels where they cannot.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP8_OBJ2_TIP:
The observatory had logged the location of a crashed freighter.
The Gek who ran the observatory visited the wreck and never returned...
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP8_MSGA: Contact Apollo at a Holo-Terminus Broadcast the glyph address for this planet Use SCAN<> to scan your surroundings
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP8_MSGB:
Contact Apollo at a Holo-Terminus
Broadcast the glyph address for this planet
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP8_MSG2: Locate the log of the crashed freighter
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP10_DESC: -null- seeks to understand more about how the universe came to be in this strange state, how the anomalies we see became so widespread. -null- feels the Vy'keen may know more. I should investigate the Mercenaries Guild and find a helpful contact.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP10_OBJ1: Perform missions for the Mercenaries Guild
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_MISSION_TIP1:
Mission boards are found in all space stations, near the teleportation terminal.
Icons let you know which faction has commissioned which mission.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_MISSION_TIP2: Find Guild Representatives on board space stations
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP10_OBJ1A: Speak to a Mercenaries Guild Representative
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP10_MSG1: Speak to the Mercenaries Guild Representative
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP10_MSG2: Complete contracts for the Mercenaries Guild: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Access the Guide (OPTIONS<>) to learn about the Mission Board
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP11_DESC:
-null- seeks to understand more about how the universe came to be in this strange state, how the anomalies we see became so widespread.
The Vy'keen told me of the crimes of the Gek, and of their long crusade against the Sentinels. They do not worship the Atlas as the other races do, distrustful of anything with such power.
The Korvax may know more. I should investigate the Explorer's Guild and find a helpful contact.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP11_OBJ1: Perform missions for the Explorers Guild
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP11_OBJ1A: Speak to an Explorers Guild Representative
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP11_MSG1: Speak to the Explorers Guild Representative
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP11_MSG2: Complete contracts for the Explorers Guild: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Access the Guide (OPTIONS<>) to learn about the Mission Board
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP12_DESC:
-null- seeks to understand more about how the universe came to be in this strange state, how the anomalies we see became so widespread.
The Korvax told me of their past as slaves to the Gek, of the violence that drove them to the Atlas. They seek to transcend their worldly existence, to live on the same plane as the Atlas.
The Gek may know more. I should investigate the Merchants Guild and find a helpful contact.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP12_OBJ1: Complete contracts for the Merchants Guild
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP12_OBJ1A: Speak to a Merchants Guild Representative
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP12_MSG1: Speak to the Merchants Guild Representative
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP12_MSG2: Complete contracts for the Merchants Guild: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Access the Guide (OPTIONS<>) to learn about the Mission Board
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP13_DESC:
The Gek revealed, perhaps unintentionally, of their horrific past, of their crimes against the other races that dominate this galaxy. Their very essence was changed by the Korvax. Does that make these Gek artificial? Can they help being anything but what they are?
I should return to -null- and tell them what I have learned.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP14_DESC:
-null- knows more about this situation than they are letting on. They believe the Atlas is in trouble, that it is dying. That the life in this universe is part of its design, part of some message to a being unknown. It communicates via the stories told by the lifeforms that live in this galaxy.
There is nothing for it. I must find another portal and face the Atlas once more.
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP14_OBJ1: Find the source of the signal
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP14_OBJ1_TIP: A familiar signal is broadcasting on a distress channel...
data.UI_CORE_ACT2_STEP15_OSD1: ENERGY SURGE DETECTED // PORTAL LEYLINE LOCATED
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP1_DESC:
I have faced the Atlas once more. I do not know how to process what I have learned. The Atlas is everywhere because we are all part of the Atlas. It is a machine, a simulation. We have no meaning beyond it.
But the machine is being destroyed. Something is happening to the Atlas. I must warn the other Travellers. I must let them know what is happening.
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP1_OBJ2_TIP: Use a HoloTerminus to alert the other Travellers to the fate of the Atlas.
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP1_MSG2: Alert other Travellers to the fate of the Atlas Locate a HoloTerminus with SCAN<>
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP1_MSG3: Alert the other Travellers to the fate of the Atlas
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP1_OSD: BROADCASTING // NETWORK COMPROMISED // NO RESPONSE DETECTED
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP2_DESC:
I have faced the Atlas once more. I do not know how to process what I have learned. The Atlas is everywhere because we are all part of the Atlas. It is a machine, a simulation. We have no meaning beyond it.
But the machine is being destroyed. Something is happening to the Atlas. I can feel it pulling me towards the centre of the galaxy, to some great cleansing...
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP2_OBJ1: Reach the Centre of the Galaxy
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP2_OBJ1_TIP1: Path towards the Galactic Core and the final Atlas Interface
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP2_OBJ1_TIP2: Optional: Complete Nada and Polo's Journey before reaching the Centre
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP2_OBJ1_TIP3: Optional: Complete the Atlas Path before reaching the Centre
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP2_OBJ1_TIP4: Interface Tunnel located. Use a Portal to reach the Centre.
data.UI_ACT3_GLYPH_OSD: DATA INJECTION SLASH<> SEQUENCE RECEIVED SLASH<> SOURCE UNKNOWN
data.UI_ACT3_GLYPH_COUNTER_16:
ATLAS Sequence: 16 / 16
Seek the Final Interface
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP3_DESC:
The Atlas is dying. It wants me to reset it, to plunge myself through its interface at the centre of the galaxy. But to do so may reset this world, my life, all that I know. I do not know if I can do it.
This galaxy is enough for me. I am content to explore, to let fate works its course without me. 
The Atlas waits for me, should I change my mind.
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP3_OBJ1_TIP: The Atlas is dying, but on an alien timescale. There are years left to explore, and countless planets to discover without resetting the Galaxy.
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP3_OBJ2_TIP: To consider resetting the galaxy, visit an Atlas Interface.
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP3_MSG2: Revisit the Atlas and reset the galaxy
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP3_MSG3:
The Atlas is dying, but on an alien timescale.
There are years left to explore, countless planets to discover.
data.UI_CORE_ACT3_STEP3_OBJ3_TIP:
The Atlas is dying, but on an alien timescale. There are years left to explore, and countless planets to discover without resetting the Galaxy.
To consider resetting the galaxy, visit an Atlas Interface.
data.UI_CORE_EPILOGUE_DESC:
I accepted the guidance of the Atlas. What choice did I have? I am part of the Atlas, I am nothing without it.
I do not know how long I have before the machine is destroyed, before the simulation ends.
But I do know I have the freedom of infinite worlds, infinite galaxies. It is mine to explore as I will. There is nothing to do but enjoy the journey.
data.UI_CORE_EPILOGUE_OBJ1_TIP:
The universe is yours to explore. Enjoy the journey
Visit a <TECHNOLOGY>Holo-Terminus<> to access other galaxy options
data.UI_CORE_EPILOGUE_OBJ3_TIP: The universe is yours to explore. Enjoy the journey
data.UI_CORE_EPILOGUE_MSG: Find a Holo-Terminus to connect to Atlas and revisit your choice
data.UI_CORE_HOLOHUB_OBJ_TIP: Locate a HoloTerminus by using SCAN<> to scan your surroundings.
data.UI_CORE_HOLOHUB_MSG1: Locate a HoloTerminus Use SCAN<> to scan your surroundings.
data.UI_CORE_COMMS_OBJ_ART: Return to space and contact Artemis
data.UI_CORE_COMMS_OBJ_APL: Return to space and contact Apollo
data.UI_CORE_COMMS_OBJ_TIP: The starship Communicator must be clear of planetary interference for long-distance communications.
data.UI_CORE_COMMS_MSG1_ART: Return to space to make contact with Artemis
data.UI_CORE_COMMS_MSG1_APL: Return to space to make contact with Apollo
data.UI_NOTIFY_FREIGHTER_DESC: The freighter's cargo is scattered across the area. Use the Scanner (SCAN<>) and the Terrain Manipulator to unearth and claim the loot.
data.UI_NOTIFY_FREIGHTER_MSG: Locate cargo: %CURRENT%/%AMOUNT% Locate pods with the Analysis Visor<> (AIM<>) Dig up with Terrain Manipulator<> Switch Multi-tool mode CYCLEWEAPON<>
data.UI_NOTIFY_NEW_SHIP:
<COMMODITY>New Ship Acquired<>
To undo this purchase,
interact with your old ship before you leave

data.FREIGHT_HAIL_DESC1: I have been hailed by a passing freighter. The lifeform who placed the call seems distressed, gesturing frantically. They seem in dire need of assistance.
data.FREIGHT_HAIL_DESC2: The lifeform, who must be the captain of this freighter, looks greatly relieved. They gesture as if to welcome me aboard their vessel.
data.DNT_EXP_FREIGHT_THANK1: Korvax says thanks and invites you aboard
data.DNT_EXP_FREIGHT_THANK2: Korvax says thanks and invites you aboard

data.TRA_NPC_DESC_23:
The trader appears to be listening to a sample of music. Voices mingle in their grand opera, a thousand lifeforms crying out in an alien tragedy...

The trader shows no sign that it has noticed me. It merely stares at the speaker, its eyes a little moist... Whatever song is playing, it haunts this creature.
data.DNT_TRA_NPC_LANG_23: The markets crashed... the Trade Lord mourned their profits... so much wealth, lost forever...
data.TRA_NPC_RES_A_23: The trader turns, startled. It accepts my units with gratitude, giving me a gift in return.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_B_23: The trader turns angrily, annoyed by my interruption. It issues a gas so strong that it pierces even the lining of my exosuit. I go before the stench can assault me further.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_C_23: The trader turns, surprised at my theft of its cultural work. It seems impressed, giving me a gift in encouragement of my deed.
data.TRA_NPC_DESC_24:
The trader sits clicking at a screen full of digits and glyphs, a balance of units present in the corner.

Every once in a while, the glyphs exchange locations, vibrating, causing the trader to shriek in delight or collapse in despair.

Eventually, the trader appears to give up, the unit balance having reached zero.
data.DNT_TRA_NPC_LANG_24: I am ruined, friend... my entire life savings lost on a foolish bet...
data.TRA_NPC_RES_A_24:
The trader takes my units greedily, but appears to lose them within mere moments of restarting their game.
They give me nanites by way of apology.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_B_24: I try to use the screen, but the trader slaps my hands away, grabbing at their multi-tool to try and stun me. I back off.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_C_24: I remain watching the trader's game before it appears to give up. It hands me an object, apparently no longer of any of use.
data.TRA_NPC_DESC_25:
The trader is extremely happy, rubbing its hands together and exuding a pleasurable scent. It shows me a live feed from a strange medical complex.
I watch machines pumping gallons of a mysterious enzyme into a vast vat of floating embryonic lifeforms.
data.DNT_TRA_NPC_LANG_25: Ah! Today I become the progenitor of five hundred spawn! Life comes at us fast, friend!
data.TRA_NPC_RES_A_25: The trader is pleased, giving me a small gift in return.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_B_25: The response from the trader is muted. It turns away from me, the pleasant scent departing.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_C_25: The trader is overjoyed, giving me an expensive gift in exchange for my own.
data.TRA_NPC_DESC_26:
The trader stares at me. After a moment's hesitation, it produces a datapad.
The screen shows images of a council of its species. Ten Lords in elaborate dress orbit various world clusters. Several images are highlighted in red and amber.
data.DNT_TRA_NPC_LANG_26: Trade Federation weakening... one by one the Trade Lords fall... which will be crushed next? We do not know...
data.TRA_NPC_OPT_A_26: Point at one of the lifeforms
data.TRA_NPC_RES_A_26:
I choose one of the Lords at random, and the lifeform's eyes follow my finger. It begins to issue a disturbing scent from its glands, clearly shaken by my suggestion.
It gives me units, wishing for me to leave.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_B_26: I try to return the datapad, but the trader sighs, gesturing for me to keep it. Within, I find nanites.
data.TRA_NPC_DESC_27:
The trader is engaged in some kind of religious observance, closing its eyes rhythmically as it repeats a mantra.
Upon my arrival, it stops. It shows me a simulated image of our own universe, the lifeforms in it growing and dying, sped up through the millennia. The edges appear to close in over time, contracting until there is nothing left.

The trader appears frightened.
data.DNT_TRA_NPC_LANG_27: Every time I run it, it shows the same thing... what is going to happen to us, friend?
data.TRA_NPC_RES_A_27: I comfort the trader, placing my hand upon its shoulder. It thanks me, giving me a gift as it calms down.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_B_27: The trader is terrified at my action, immediately switching the simulation back on. They wish for me to leave.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_C_27: I offer the lifeform GekNip, helping it to de-stress. It gives me units in exchange for my help.
data.TRA_NPC_DESC_28:
Something about the trader's posture makes them feel larger than many I have encountered amongst its species; their eyes seem to glow with undaunted power.
As my eyes move, it is as if I see two beings standing in the one place: one small, one strong.
It glares at me, showing me a handful of metal shards.
data.DNT_TRA_NPC_LANG_28: Why do the Korvax still walk free? What have you done with our legacy?
data.TRA_NPC_RES_A_28: I scan the shards, revealing them to be a currency used by the Gek over a thousand years ago. The creature eyes me warily. It gives me a gift of nanites.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_B_28: I take the shards, pleasing the lifeform. But nothing else happens... all I am left with is useless metal.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_C_28: I threaten the lifeform with my multi-tool. It merely smiles, giving me a weapon upgrade so that one day I might pose a fair challenge.
data.TRA_NPC_DESC_29:
The trader is anxious, looking past me as I approach.
Seemingly satisfied that I am alone, it looks up and thrusts a sealed box towards me.
data.DNT_TRA_NPC_LANG_29: Trade Federation know I stole from them - take evidence, friend! Quick!
data.TRA_NPC_RES_A_29:
I take the box, finding a valuable nanite cluster within.
When I return, the trader does not even acknowledge our previous interaction.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_B_29: The trader conceals the box at once, wary of detection.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_C_29: I upload a report to the system authorities, receiving a reward for my troubles. They will determine this Gek's fate.
data.TRA_NPC_DESC_30: The trader stares at a cup. It appears to contain a dark black liquid, hot to the touch...
data.DNT_TRA_NPC_LANG_30: I do not know what I would do without this stuff... it is a fine cup, friend.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_A_30:
I start to drink the liquid, but before it can reach my lips the trader lunges at me. They tear the cup from my grasp and spill some of the liquid on my suit.
They are upset, but apologetic about the spillage. They give me units as compensation.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_B_30: I take and empty the cup, causing the trader to cry.
data.TRA_NPC_RES_C_30: I offer units for the cup, but the trader gives me some of the liquid for free. It invigorates me, waking me up.
data.EXP_NPC_DESC_26:
The electronic lifeform taps on its datapad, manipulating a projection of a small lifeform riding a two-wheeled exocraft. The projection navigates many dangers and obstacles, occasionally falling from its path.

The lifeform offers me a datapad as I approach.
data.DNT_EXP_NPC_LANG_26: Unknown entity, join communion. Eheu! Help Korvax finish puzzle!
data.EXP_NPC_RES_A_26:
I take the datapad and a second lifeform appears on the projection, wearing a red helmet. Together we complete the puzzle.
Delighted, the entity awards me with a gift for my cooperation.
data.EXP_NPC_RES_B_26: I refuse to participate in this activity, instead watching as the electronic lifeform repeatedly falls from the path. Eventually, the Korvax throws their datapad at me in what appears to be anger.
data.EXP_NPC_DESC_27:
The electronic lifeform examines me as I stand before it. They see everything, not just my expression but my exosuit, my breathing, everything they can observe.
The Korvax speaks with multiple voices, lights rapidly fading in and out of focus upon its mask. More than one lifeform inhabits this body.
Each shows me a projection of water, oceans, streams... each seems panicked.
data.DNT_EXP_NPC_LANG_27: Korvax Convergence warn Traveller - warn all - do not - touch the water - containment has been breached. It is happening again -
data.EXP_NPC_RES_A_27:
The Korvax unit does not respond, its lights growing completely dark before another soul fills its carapace.
It offers Nanite Clusters on behalf of its previous occupant, but appears to possess little memory of what it said before.
data.EXP_NPC_RES_B_27:
The Korvax unit does not respond, its lights growing completely dark before another soul fills its carapace.
It offers Nanite Clusters on behalf of its previous occupant, but appears to possess little memory of what it said before.
data.EXP_NPC_RES_C_27:
The Korvax unit does not respond, its lights growing completely dark before another soul fills its carapace.
It offers Nanite Clusters on behalf of its previous occupant, but appears to possess little memory of what it said before.
data.EXP_NPC_DESC_28:
The electronic lifeform appears to be listening to a strange rhythm on their datapad. Every time it touches the pad, light pulses emerge from the screen, punctuated by occasional chatter.

The lifeform looks up at me, its music continuing to play.
data.DNT_EXP_NPC_LANG_28: Existence... disconnection... rebirth... around the world...
data.EXP_NPC_RES_A_28: The lifeform accepts my units with gratitude, playing all the more loudly. I have encouraged it in its musical endeavours, and so it gives me a gift in return.
data.EXP_NPC_RES_B_28: The lifeform is angry at the interruption and throws its datapad to the floor. It is unable to produce art in these conditions.
data.EXP_NPC_RES_C_28: The lifeform appears to be flattered by emulation, giving me a gift so that I might be encouraged in my own work.
data.EXP_NPC_DESC_29:
The electronic lifeform contemplates the universe around itself, inattentive to my arrival.
Yet as I step closer, I see that something is wrong. Nanite clusters pool within every crevice of its suit...
data.DNT_EXP_NPC_LANG_29: Help... me... do not touch... containment breached...
data.EXP_NPC_OPT_B_29: Use multi-tool to burn them off
data.EXP_NPC_RES_A_29: I try to take the Nanite Clusters, but immediately the Korvax grabs my arm, depowering my exosuit in the process.
data.EXP_NPC_RES_B_29: I use my multi-tool to burn away the clusters. When it is purged, the lifeform stands, shaking. They give me a gift in thanks.
data.EXP_NPC_DESC_30: The electronic lifeform stares at a hologram of another, the lights on both their masks waxing and waning. They appear concerned.
data.DNT_EXP_NPC_LANG_30: Our entity has been disconnected. It failed its life test... where did we go wrong?
data.EXP_NPC_RES_A_30: They stare at me, unable to understand. I leave them in their sadness.
data.EXP_NPC_RES_B_30: I offer Nanite Clusters. Greedily, the lifeforms take them to forget their pain.
data.EXP_NPC_RES_C_30: The lifeforms seem to take some consolation in my gift, rewarding me with nanites.
data.WAR_NPC_DESC_23: The warrior removes their helmet, spittle rolling down from its mouth. It invites me to put the helmet on my own head.
data.DNT_WAR_NPC_LANG_23: Interloper - watch this... You will gain knowledge... courage... grah...
data.WAR_NPC_RES_A_23:
As I put the helmet over my head, I see that there is a screen upon the inside. Suddenly I am transported, seeing a vision of the entire universe. I am all that I can see.. but it is not the universe as it is now.
I look down at myself, seeing the body of a Vy'keen, aged, worn... I began to rip myself apart...
The helmet comes off. The warrior nods approvingly, giving me nanites to assist in my travels.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_B_23: I refuse. The warrior seems to care little, turning aside from me.
data.WAR_NPC_DESC_24:
The warrior appears to be flexing its muscles as I approach, holding its body in various stances.
It beckons me forth, forming fists with its hands.
data.DNT_WAR_NPC_LANG_24: Grah! Face me, Interloper! Prepare for battle!
data.WAR_NPC_RES_A_24:
As I approach, the warrior lunges forward and places my head within its arms, proceeding to beat me severely.
After a while, apparently disappointed at the poor level of challenge I presented, it gives me compensation for my time and heals my wounds.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_B_24: The warrior shrugs and turns back to its practice.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_C_24:
I draw my weapon, causing the warrior to become enraged at my disrespect.
It begins to shout and spit, and delivers me a short, sharp slap.
data.WAR_NPC_DESC_25:
The warrior glares at me, its skin sagging, its frame evidently in pain. Yet still it tries to stand and face me...
It has been reading an ancient text - a bloodied scroll with Vy'keen script. Upon it I see an image of two warriors standing before a Great Monolith, a dagger held behind one of their backs. There are sixteen such images upon the scroll.
data.DNT_WAR_NPC_LANG_25: Tell me, interloper... do you know the secret of this universe?
data.WAR_NPC_RES_A_25: The warrior is disturbed by my answer. They give me what little technology they possess to help me bear this burden.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_B_25: I point to the dagger and the warrior nods approvingly, whispering the name 'Nal'. It gives me units to assist my work.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_C_25: I point to the Monolith and the warrior grows stern at my answer. It has little left to say to me.
data.WAR_NPC_DESC_26:
The warrior is exasperated, screaming down its communicator channel at what appears to be an infant of its own species.
The warrior turns the communicator towards me, barking instructions in an alien tongue.
data.DNT_WAR_NPC_LANG_26: Do you wish to end up like this pathetic interloper, child? You must train harder...
data.WAR_NPC_RES_A_26: I join in the screaming, causing the infant to cry. The warrior shakes its head in disappointment at the infant, giving me a token reward for my troubles.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_B_26: I distort my expression in an attempt to amuse the infant, but it begins to growl at me instead. Delighted, the warrior rewards me handsomely.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_C_26: I fire a warning shot, causing the infant to snap to attention. Impressed, the warrior rewards me with nanites and begins to shout at the infant once more.
data.WAR_NPC_DESC_27:
The warrior is forlorn. It shows me an image of two members of its species embracing.
It appears to be weeping.
data.DNT_WAR_NPC_LANG_27: Grah! I cannot forgive this treason... they were my Consort, interloper!
data.WAR_NPC_RES_A_27: I embrace the warrior. After a few moments, it screams at me to leave.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_B_27:
I smash the image. The warrior stares at it for a moment before starting to laugh.
It gives me an unknown Vy'keen's possessions by way of thanks.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_C_27: I move to dry its tears, but the warrior appears to be too ashamed to allow such sympathy. It begs me to leave, bribing me to tell no-one of its shame.
data.WAR_NPC_DESC_28:
The warrior watches its brethren on a screen, a squadron of fighters holding multi-tools and blunt weapons. They stand on a platform half a universe away. Off-camera, enemies appear to be screaming. Flames erupt near the feet of the warriors...
Their leader holds out its multi-tool, strings of energy extending forth. They begin to pluck the strings, the sounds mingling with the unholy din of blunt weapons smashed against the shells of dead Sentinels...
The watcher does not notice me, and the performance continues on the screen...
data.DNT_WAR_NPC_LANG_28: They tried to shut us down. Grah! The Crimson Sentinels will never be silenced. One - two - three - four -
data.WAR_NPC_RES_A_28: The warrior turns. It appears angered by the association between money and music. It begins to spit and shout, demanding that I leave.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_B_28: The warrior is angry at the interruption, throwing various objects at me to get me to leave. One of them appears to be useful.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_C_28: The warrior turns and hears my attempt to mimic its music. It joins in, shouting and crying, inhaling battle gas periodically. When I leave, it gives me nanites in appreciation of my untamed spirit.
data.WAR_NPC_DESC_29:
The warrior stands to attention, handing me a communication somehow tailored to my own language.
It informs me that the Vy'keen High Command has placed this system under temporary democratic rule until a state of emergency is lifted.
The warrior shows me multiple candidates for the system primarch.
data.DNT_WAR_NPC_LANG_29: Grah! Vote for strongest is vote to end voting! Interloper, choose correctly!
data.WAR_NPC_RES_A_29: The warrior is pleased with my choice, giving me a gift in encouragement.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_B_29: The warrior is angered by my choice, but respects my temporary right to make it.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_C_29: The warrior is disgusted by my choice. After recording it, they headbutt me and demand that I leave.
data.WAR_NPC_DESC_30:
This warrior is different to others I have encountered... it bears the insignia of its species, yet there is something else, an air of pride and superiority.
It shows me a schematic for an Exocraft as large as a space station. Underneath its wheels are crudely drawn images of Gek and Sentinels.
data.DNT_WAR_NPC_LANG_30: Grah! Admire my works and despair, interloper...
data.WAR_NPC_RES_A_30: I express my admiration for the image. In return the warrior rewards me with nanites. It gestures as if to warn me from stealing their idea.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_B_30: I laugh at the image and in return the warrior shoots me in the foot.
data.WAR_NPC_RES_C_30:
I add an image of a weapon to the schematic. Initially the warrior seems sceptical, alarmed at my attempt to interfere.
But when they see what I have created, they stare at me and begin to slowly clap their approval. They give me the finest Nanite Clusters so that I may see our vision realised.
data.FTH_NPC_DESC_1:
The strange being seems to stare right through me, as if they are not truly there.
And then I see it. There is dried blood caked across its exosuit, splattered across its face.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_A_1: It was in such – <STELLAR>kzzktt<> – agony, I had to save it. Please, there was no profit, you can have everything I took. I’ll tell their family...
data.FTH_NPC_RES_B_1: I don’t need your absolution. I did – kzzktt – agony, what I must... I wanted to spread happiness and joy. Would you like some?
data.FTH_NPC_RES_C_1:
I draw my multi-tool and demand that it tells me everything, but it is pointless. They just stare up at me and grin.
I see it then, the flesh within their teeth...
data.FTH_NPC_DESC_2:
The strange being tries to hand me something. But whatever it is, it is immaterial, shimmering in and out of existence.
The lifeform begins to cry, despairing at its own impending disappearance. For a moment I see another universe, a place utterly unlike anything I have ever encountered.
data.FTH_NPC_LANG_2: Irrevocably – <STELLAR>kzkzzt<> – corrupted corrupted corrupted. Take, please – final proof we existed – that – that –
data.FTH_NPC_OPT_A_2: Stay with them until the end
data.FTH_NPC_RES_A_2:
A life and a universe are consumed in a blaze of white, and yet the lifeform is still here, apparently unaware of anything that just occurred.
As I leave, they ask if I have received any troubling readings. They are afraid something is happening to their world...
data.FTH_NPC_RES_B_2:
They tell me that there was an experiment. There were some who doubted if their universe was real, if the world was just a dream.
They did not mean for any of this to happen. They begin to shake as the white space approaches, beseeching me, imploring me not to repeat their mistake...
...and just like that, the vision recedes. We both stand here as if nothing has happened.
As I leave, they ask if I have received any troubling readings. They are afraid something is happening to their world...
data.FTH_NPC_RES_C_2:
The stranger whispers through their tears. I know it made a sound, but the memory seems to immediately disappear from my mind.
I try again, and again, and the stranger grows frantic at my inability to remember them. Time and space slip away...
and just like that, the vision recedes. We both stand here as if nothing has happened.
As I leave, they ask if I have received any troubling readings. They are afraid something is happening to their world...
data.FTH_NPC_DESC_3:
The lifeform dons a mask of undulating nanite clusters, and for a moment, their face appears to become my own. I see myself looking at myself looking at myself...
I am going to die. I am sure of it.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_A_3:
I push the lifeform away, but it is myself I push.
The mask falls off as I fall, and I am standing there again, once more myself. But the lifeform is displeased, claiming that I have learned nothing. That I rejected their gift...
data.FTH_NPC_RES_B_3:
I embrace the lifeform, but it is myself I embrace.
The mask withers, peeling from my face like flesh. I am myself again...But the lifeform is saddened. They offer me pity.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_C_3:
I die.
I died, I know I did. I felt it, like sinking. Like being watched, forever... And yet here I am again. The stranger smiles at me, claiming that they will see me again. Before I leave, they give me a gift...
data.FTH_NPC_DESC_4:
The lifeform tries to shake my hand, but pauses as we phase through one another. They are fascinated by the encounter, claiming to be a Traveller.
It is clear they come from a very different region of space. They have never heard of the Gek, Vy'keen, Korvax, or any of the sights I have encountered. They wish to know more in the spirit of cooperation.
data.FTH_NPC_LANG_4: Hm. Unexpected. Hello, my new friend. What business would – <STELLAR>kzkzztt<> - you have with me?
data.FTH_NPC_RES_A_4:
I offer the Traveller everything I know about the species I have encountered, for a price.
The Traveller looks disappointed. They do nothing more than turn away, but they seem deeply hurt.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_B_4:
I tell the Traveller about the species I have encountered, sharing with them my scans, the names of planets I have been to, the words I have learned.
They are curious, asking more and more. Nothing I say satisfies them. Eventually, disappointed, they grow quiet.
They hand me a gift, thanking me for what little I was able to tell them.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_C_4:
I ask whether the Traveller has ever encountered or heard of an entity known as 'Atlas'. The Traveller smiles, claiming they have not. I attempt to continue the conversation, but they bring it to an end.
As I go, they grab my hand, warning me not to go to the centre. They warn me not to listen...
data.FTH_NPC_DESC_6: The Traveller removes an object from their exosuit. It looks abstract, crimson, flesh-like, perfect...
data.FTH_NPC_LANG_6:
Another Traveller, hm. Well, we should speak.
Have faith. Not all dreams are idle fancies. Not all fictions are untruths. Perhaps all of this is based in something real. Perhaps we did once exist, long ago...
Proof? Here, look at this...
data.FTH_NPC_RES_A_6:
I look at the object and am filled with a sense of hope. Everything will be alright. I know it. Nothing can hurt me.
All I have to do is believe and have faith... not in a deity, not in some universal tyrant. No...
It is this, right in front of me.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_B_6:
I refuse to look at the object, turning away from the Traveller.
They claim that they understand, that perhaps I am not ready for their truth. They wish me well.
data.FTH_NPC_DESC_7: The Traveller shows me an image of a Gek. They watch me keenly, explaining that they were hired to find this individual by the Trade Federation itself.
data.FTH_NPC_LANG_7: Hold. I'm looking for a missing Gek. Perhaps you'd recognise this face?
data.FTH_NPC_OPT_B_7: Suggest this is not a Gek
data.FTH_NPC_RES_A_7: The Traveller claims they cannot comment. They seem disappointed that I know nothing, and wish me good luck with my journey.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_B_7:
The Traveller is shocked, but their suspicion grows. I tell them the Gek in question is no Gek at all, but a dangerous Korvax imposter known as a 'SynthetiGek'.
They interrogate me and, when satisfied I am not involved, they give me compensation for my time.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_C_7:
The Traveller is pleased. They ask where I saw the Gek. But when I transmit some coordinates from a few systems back, they grow angry. They say these coordinates are meaningless.
They interrogate me and, when finally satisfied that I know nothing, they give me a little compensation for my time.
data.FTH_NPC_DESC_8:
The Traveller's appearance, its manner, the way it speaks... all of them feel archaic, like nothing I have heard before.
They repeat their question, threatening to draw their Multi-Sword.
data.FTH_NPC_LANG_8: Who do you serve? Which Baron is master of this place?
data.FTH_NPC_RES_A_8:
The Traveller grows increasingly agitated, claiming that it is a simple question. I explain that there is no single ruler.
They ask me to prepare for invasion by the Great King, to spread the word far and wide. They give me a boon for my service.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_B_8:
The Traveller grows nervous immediately, its demeanour changing to one of begrudging respect. They claim they have a message from the Great King. I am warned to bend a knee or face destruction.
They give me a gift as a token of the riches that await me should I come to a just and wise decision.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_C_8:
The Traveller draws their Multi-Sword, claiming that I must jest. They declare that their insignia and mandate are clear: they are the Sheriff of the Great King.
They claim my lands are forfeit, and that I will regret this disrespectful incident...
data.FTH_NPC_DESC_9: The Traveller looks down, their eyes full of pain.
data.FTH_NPC_LANG_9:
We were born too late to make a difference. I wonder, sometimes. If there's any point in going on. If anything matters, if history will just sweep everything away.
I'm sorry. I'm in a strange mood... After all, these are the last days, are they not?
data.FTH_NPC_RES_A_9:
The Traveller tries to smile, but fails even that. I try to tell them that there is a whole universe out there, that there is value in living, even if life will end.
They thank me for trying to help. They give me one of their possessions, claiming that they will not need it anymore.
data.FTH_NPC_RES_B_9:
